description: Rock Golems are beings made from the hardest of stone and rock, bound together by powerful natural magic. Their massive forms are all but impervious to damage and are capable of crushing any man or beast that dares threaten them. The Oldest and most grumpy of their kind get so angry they go molten with rage. The added fiery heat from these giant beings makes them even more dangerous!

Vampires are evil undead beings that sustain their long lives by feeding upon the blood of their victims. Those that dwell in this dark place are bound to a dark coven, all members are given powerful blood red rings that give them power over others and even spirits. The most powerful of these Vampires are almost crumbling away they are so old, yet are powerful enough to hunt in the open and even withstand some sunlight.

Few have survived encounters with the near-mythical Fire Golems. Legends state that the black steel cage-like effigies that contain the roaring fire of the Golem within were created by Mages deep under a fiery mountain, and thus it is they who these beings will serve until they are extinguished.

The Nightshade are a group of Elven guardians often seen around the Paladir forest and surrounding caves. Their business is their own but is generally assumed that to confront them is a dire thing to do for those who have in the past are never seen again...
These hideous beasts have been corrupted by the Shadow Lord, now bent on draining the blood and life force of every living thing in the world of Erildath.
These once powerful wizards of the old world were turned to the darkness by the vampire lords. These vampire magi now wander the world of Erildath, seeking out enemies of the Shadow Lord.
These large warlike humanoids thrive on destruction.

Unleashed from the ethereal world by the Shadow Lord, the Ravager is a demon thought to possess powerful demonic powers. The Ravager has been sighted across the world of Erildath, unleashing its potent hellish powers against those who dare offer resistance.
Ice Wolf Champions are second in comand of the Ice wolf packs. They lead Small groups of other Ice wolfs out on the hunt for prey.
This undead flying horror is capable of cutting down its victim in one deadly swoop. This paticular breed is more vicious than its younger sibling, the  Skull Horror.
The Yeti is a creature with as bad a temper as its smell! Known in the Ice Elves stories as a child eater to scare the young, but in reality it doesn't mind who or what it eats...
Unleashed from the demon lords inhabiting the southern regions of Mora, the Red Devil is capable of smiting its foe in one swipe from its deadly claws.
Frogmen champions are the sworn protectors of the Frogmen tribes.

The Armored Hedera is a humanoid plant like creature composed of leafy vines. Hederas are known to take up the weapons and armor of past snacks which makes them even more of a powerful adversary to take on.
Swamp Zombies are the reanimated corpses of dead adventurers by evil magics. The swamp zombies are relentless in their hunger for the living.
Crocomen are huge humanoid crocodiles that live within the swamps. They are worshiped as gods of evil and death by the primitive Frogmen tribes for good reason...

Zebra Centaurs are a bad tempered race. Disliking outsiders within the lands of Azlore they will stop at nothing to expel foreigners to the land with their mighty speed and power and few can outrun a centaur...
Voodoo Zombies are the undead slaves of the Witch Doctors, doing the Witch Doctors bidding without question.
Azlorie Head Hunters are one of the warrior castes in the tribes of the Azlorie. The Head Hunters collect the heads of vanquished foes as part of there death cult religion.
The Azlorie Lion is a strange and cunning monster. The Azlorie Lion uses its unnatural ability to lure its victims to it where they shall find death at the end of pointed teeth and sharp claws...
The Mushcaria Beast champions were the first of these types of beasts to be magically created in the magical experiment and being the first they are also the most powerful of their kind.

The Dwarf Master Woodsmen are the most wise of the Dwarf Woodsmen as they know all the magical secrets in growing the local tree types. The Dwarf Master Woodsmen are also hate all outsiders to the forest and will resort to force to remove them?
Wood Elf Maid leaders are masters of hand to hand combat and will attack trespassers to their realm without a second thought.
Two Stripe Marauder Orcs are often led by self appointed leaders who are basically just bigger and meaner than the other Orcs around him at the time!

Ipos Hellions are vile demons composed of insect-like parts and have bodies made up from worms. Ipos Hellions take great pleasure in swooping over their prey lopping off heads and limbs before moving in to devour the fallen body...
The Iron Face Orcs live in the Jahd Swamps where they roam around looking for anything to fight and possibly eat!
Mud Monsters live in the wet areas of the Jahd Swamps. They prey on unsuspecting creatures and people who wander past the places they live by drowning them in the mud that the monsters call home.
Giant Fiddler crabs swarm the Beaches in these parts. Although the smaller type is normally scavengers, these bigger, meaner variations are very aggressive and will tear potential prey apart!
Great Poison frogs are larger than the Poison frogs. The Great Poison frog is rare but is even more poisonous than there smaller cousins.
The Anklar Sand Worm waits for its prey to come into striking distance of its burrow where it then springs out to kill its intended prey with its poison bite.

The Sand Djinn are magical creatures of animated sand. They have magic power over sand and can morph it into weapons to kill. Sand Djinn are often blamed by local people for creating droughts and bad sand storms.
This deadly creature hides within the volcanic landscape, luring its victims closer before lunging upon them and tearing them apart before devouring the remains.
These small, seemingly defenseless creatures conceal a great strength, for one swipe from its claws renders the most strongest of opponents unconscious from the venom carried through the claws.

The Giant Grintz Bee is unusual among species of bee as it can sting as often as it wants without fear of losing its sting and dying itself. The stinger itself contains a poison that can melt flesh in seconds.

Emerald Tree Vipers don't eat often but when one is hungry they become fearless and will attack anything that breaths regardless of its size, which it will then swallow alive and go away to slowly digest its meal.

The Vexus Wasp is an evil creature that uses a unique form off poison gas attack to subdue its prey. It uses its poison gas to nock out its prey and when it is defenceless the Vexus Wasp moves in for the kill.
The ash waste Shaman are born with magical powers and are normally the head of the nomad communities for the others fear and respect anyone who can shoot fire from their hands!
Ashen Brutes are soulless killers who rise from the ground to attack at will. Using Great Axes they can make short work of even the toughest opponents.

Magma Beasts are ancient demons made from the raw power within a volcano. The Magma Beasts reside within volcanoes sleeping but sometimes they are unleashed by erupting volcanoes and they then set about terrorizing the area having been disturbed from their slumber.

The Bloodhorns were once a skilled unit of warriors who had won fame for the heroic deeds they did. However a jealous necromancer cursed the unit and the once heroic Bloodhorns mutated and became the evil creatures of undeath they are today.

Waste Stalker champions silently move across the wastelands in search of prey. They are skilled in using the huge swords they carry and can easily end an unlucky soul's life with one blow from the sword.
The Flesh Golem champions are the evil flesh warlock's personal bodyguards. They have slightly more intelligence than the normal Flesh Golems making them more useful to the warlocks.
Flesh Centaur champions are the most intelligent of the Flesh Centaurs and have complete control of their magic which they can use to destroy enemies even more powerful than themselves.

The Yari is a large lion like creature that lives only on these floating islands. The Yari is the largest predator on the islands and is extremely aggressive when disturbed. Some Yari's are domesticated by the locals to act as guard animals to the islands.

The White Elnorphants are a species of near mythical beasts that have evolved from normal Elephants upon the islands. White Elnorphants are extremely intelligent and myths of them being able to communicate with humans and even cast spells are common on the islands.
Centagus Knights are the best equipped of the Centagur armies and have got a fearsome reputation for swooping from the sky and impaling their enemies upon their spears.
The Naral Pegasus is a magnificent creature to behold yet if it feels it or its young are in danger the Naral Pegasus will not hesitate in attacking anyone it sees as a threat.

The huge creature known as the Swamp Wyrm is a terrible sight to behold. The beast is more than capable of swallowing its prey whole and often surprised its enemies by moving extraordinarily quickly despite its titanic size.
Desolator Champions are the strongest of their kind. In local legends and tales the Desolator Champion named Luzzxt ate the entire Elf royal court that is rumoured to have once existed in the area.

The Khazal Gargoyles were created as a method to deter people from entering the tower and stealing things. Many years since the fall and ruin of the tower and the Gargoyles still exist here still doing what they were created for.

The Ogres of Pelsar are more savage than most ogres yet have a very strong spiritual connection to their home in the Canyons. The Ogres decorate their bodies in protective tattoos believing that they will protect them in battle.

The Black Dogs of Crombe are a unnatural breed and it is suspected they have been tainted by evil magic. Most of the Black Dogs have two heads that will even fight with each other over the last scrap of a meal.

Soil Golems exist in the soft soil in the moors and if disturbed they quickly rise and kill they creature that disturbed them, dragging the body back with them where the deceased will in time decompose and re-fertilise the Soil Golem.

Plains Trolls are large gangly beasts, unlike much like any other Troll type that tend to look well fed. These Trolls are more cunning and bold in their actions as it lives in a land where food is scarce and there is little terrain for the Troll to hide in ambush so it must make bold open attacks on its prey. The fastest of their kind are the most successful hunters and leaders of their small tribes.
The Itzsu Goblins are the local tribe of Greenskins in Khel. They are expert hunters and skilled with their harpoons and can hunt down large Whales and Giant Khel Bears with ease.

The lands of Daradom are plagued by the creatures known as Lava Raptors. The Lava Raptors seem quite at home in the sweltering heat and use the heat to there advantage when hunting prey by waiting on the prey to tire in the heat before moving in for the kill.

The Ruir Orcs are new to the land of Maedos, having been cast out of their own lands in Bahruir. The Ruir Orc champions are the most cunning of their kind and normally lead the tribes raiding parties.

Malefor Asphyxiators use a strange weapon that spays out a deadly nerve gas that's been devised by the Malefor Techno Magi. The Leaders of the Malefor Asphyxiators have recently been directing the purging of the lands original Orc inhabitants.

The Malefor Techno Magi are practitioners of a form metal magic and have been experimenting with new ideas for machines, weapons and strange new concoctions. The highest of the Order of Malefor Techno Magi are the only ones aloud to practice the most dangerous metal magic spells.

Little is known of the creatures known as Lobsteroids. Appearances of these beasts appear from time to time in sailor's tales and many suspect that the Lobsteroids are the worshipers of a vengeful sea god that controls the waters or that they cause the hazardous seas in the area themselves with magic.

The Goblins of the Bone face tribe are the only intelligent creatures that live on the island and even then they are little more than savages compared with most. They don't take kindly to strangers on their island and are quick to hunt them down and bring them to their tribe feast...as the main course!

The Anklorn Crystal Beast is a master of ambush and lay in wait of their prey, camouflaged amongst the crystals growing in the caves. The Anklorn Crystal Beast is covered with a natural crystal armor that makes it incredibly hard to kill in battle.
Greater Black Jaguar is a powerful but thankfully rare relation to the Greater Jaguar. It is considered a delicacy to the local goblin tribes due to its rich tasting meat.

Falagi Death Demons stalk the lands of Falagi worshiping their foul gods of death and destruction. The most loyal of the Death Demons are blessed by their gods and soon become the champions of their kind.

The Ankurian Bull Riders are the most powerful and feared tribe in Ankura and all others in the land must bow down and pay respect to them. The Ankurian's champions ride the largest and most fearsome bulls and use them as a status symbol and a powerful weapon in battle.

Blue Tigers are almost unheard of and often only subject to myth. However the lands of Asjal teams with them. Some myths told by nomads of Asjal say that the Blue Tigers have leaders among them and that they are the champions of the mythical Asura King Vashku's army.

These half human/half demon beings have been distorted by the chaotic evil residing in the dark lands. Their strange powers are capable of "flaying" apart its prey, thus presenting a somewhat devastating opponent.

The Xexk Brute are guardians of the old world, protecting the ancient portals and watching over the dark realms. Equipped with a massive hammer, the Xexk Brute is capable of smashing his victims to a bloody pulp.

Th Ralath Inferno is a tormented and cursed being and exists in a permanent state of burning and pain. It believes it can pass on its curse to others by burning them alive. This can never work and so continues the Ralath Infernos trail of destruction across the land.

The Gralli are an insect like race and harbor a deep hatred for anything that is not insect like. Warrior Gralli are very drone like and loyal, following the orders of their chiefs and never quit a mission until it is accomplished or they are all dead.
Swamp Elementals instinctively protect the swamp from harm. The are the white blood cells of the Nimaos Swamps and will die protecting this place.

The Bearcats of Osserand are a type of beastman. Unlike the tribes of Ghelmot Bearcats, they have a more sophisticated culture and have began to dabble with ice magic making them a more dangerous foe to encounter.

The creatures known as the Benthius are beings made from sea plants. They seem to hold a great hatered for the creaturs that live on the land and often come ashore to attack randomly. Legends of the area tell that there may be a link between the Benthius and a story telling of local people being cursed to live in the sea for eternity.
Surfron Centaur Hunters patrol the desert hunting creatures to feed the tribes. They dont like tresspassers to the hunting grounds and see them as thiefs and will attack them when spotted.
Many legends suround the beings known as Will o' the Wisps. One such legend tells that the Whisps are evil spirits doomed to wander the marshes and lead travelers to their deaths.

Giant Ephal Crocodiles are so huge and impresive that the few crazy natives in the swamp worship them as gods and feed them live food as offerings. It is said in ancient legends that the natives harbor a secret and that these Crocodiles really are the protector gods that help keep the secret safe. Of course this is just a legend though...
The Grothan Cyclops live nomadic lives up on the secret path known as Grothan Way. They believe it is their duty to stop outsiders from travelling the paths to the lands beyond by any means possible.

The Pugot is terrifying beast to behold. Despite its size it can move silently through the mists and when it comes across its prey it lets of a ear peircing scream. This is often the last thing the Pugots prey ever hears.

In a land full of unknown creatures and living fossils it was highly likely that Neanderthals were also existing here to. The Neanderthal Hunters roam the grassland hunting anything they can with their stone weapons, including any who they feel as a threat to them such as a strangers in their hunting grounds.
The dire wolf is an evil and destructive type of wolf. Almost all of these animals are infected by rabies making them an even more unplesant and dangerous foe to fight against.

The Proto Orc is a primative form of the Orc that is normaly found on the outside world. They are extinct elsewhere just like all the other creatures here in these lands. The Proto Orc differs from normal Orcs as it is even less intelegent but more powerfull and animal like when it attacks.

Only in the darkest areas of the caves will the Shadow Cave Crawlers be found. Tales are told that these demons came to this world through a portal to another realm left open deep in a forgotten cave. It could also just be that the demons hate light and seek the caves as protection from it. These demons are so nimble they can even crawl along walls.

Giant Sea Scorpions as longer than a manhunt in the shallows around Hygme and even on the beach. These creatures are armed with powerful claws and shells as hard as iron and they are relentless in their quest for food.

The Cerenians are a breed of fish man that live deep in the sea. They are a war like race but are at war with another race from under the sea, the Thetos. However they do come ashore to raid and loot setlements for weapons and items that are rare to find in the sea for use in their undewater war.

Liverworts are normaly quiet creatures who move around in small groups feeding on the plant life that grows in the swamps. However if threatend they become fearsome opponents and are likely to smash their foe into a bloody mess!

Their massive forms are all but impervious to damage and are capable of crushing any man or beast that dares threaten them. The Oldest and most grumpy of their kind get so angry they go molten with rage. The added fiery heat from these giant beings makes them even more dangerous!

The Neanderthal Hunters roam the grassland hunting anything they can with their stone weapons, including any who they feel as a threat to them such as a strangers in their hunting grounds.
The dire wolf is an evil and destructive type of wolf. Almost all of these animals are infected by rabies making them an even more unplesant and dangerous foe to fight against.

The Proto Orc is a primative form of the Orc that is normaly found on the outside world. They are extinct elsewhere just like all the other creatures here in these lands. The Proto Orc differs from normal Orcs as it is even less intelegent but more powerfull and animal like when it attacks.

Only in the darkest areas of the caves will the Shadow Cave Crawlers be found. Tales are told that these demons came to this world through a portal to another realm left open deep in a forgotten cave. It could also just be that the demons hate light and seek the caves as protection from it. These demons are so nimble they can even crawl along walls.

Giant Sea Scorpions as longer than a manhunt in the shallows around Hygme and even on the beach. These creatures are armed with powerful claws and shells as hard as iron and they are relentless in their quest for food.

The Cerenians are a breed of fish man that live deep in the sea. They are a war like race but are at war with another race from under the sea, the Thetos. However they do come ashore to raid and loot setlements for weapons and items that are rare to find in the sea for use in their undewater war.

Liverworts are normaly quiet creatures who move around in small groups feeding on the plant life that grows in the swamps. However if threatend they become fearsome opponents and are likely to smash their foe into a bloody mess!
The Aquiasaur is expertly suited to life in the darkness of the forests and takes advantage of this with its superior night sight and natural camouflage.

The mist like Peitha Apparition roam the forests. Who or what the Peitha Apparition once were is unknown but it is rumoured that they are the creatures of the eerie mists thats often envelope the area.

The beings known as the Tyali Golems have wanderd the grass lands for over a hundred years. Legends say that their creator lost control of the Tyali Golems and they went bezerk. Long after the passing of their creator the Tyali Golems still weak havok on the land.

Ponea is home to tribes of reptilian Dinosauroids. They are much more intelligent than your average giant reptile that is normally encountered in the area but still have the predatory instincts needed to be efficient predators.

Dinosauroid Berzerkers are insanely savage reptilian creatures. They are sightly more intelligent than their Ponea cousins and have mastered steel making and use it in creating wicked weapons to fight with.

Inudum Scouts ride the frosen wastes atop large reptilian beasts known as Hadrosaurs. Both the scouts skill with the spear and the Hadrosaurs power make encountering one of the Inudum Scout Riders a very dangerous prospect where you are as likely to be trampled to death as well as skewerd.
The fort of Luivak is home to the Inudum Guard. These warriors are well trained and will die to protect the Fort.

Dwarf Treasure Hunters from other kingdoms have heard of the destruction of the Ruzdum Dwarfs. They come to Korundor in search of loot and long lost treasures. Often groups of Treasure Hunters come under the leadership of a skilled champion for better protection and and better chance of finding loot!

Each tribe of Ghouls in the Dark Vale is ruled over by the strongest and most evil of Ghoul in it. These Ghouls are primitive creatures and often boast to the tribe that their god of death has visited them in a vision or in a dream. Such claims are often made just so the Ghoul can keep its place at the head of the tribe.

Necromantic Terrors are the bodyguards of Dagoresh. It is said that the Necromantic Terrors were once an elite group of knights hired by the Dwarfs to go deep into the Maw and kill Dagoresh but they never returned. Some of the Terrors show some intelligence and may have once been the leaders of the knights that perished here.

The Dwarven King of Morukan is skilled in combat and is heavly armed with custom armor and powerful rune weapons. However the King harbours a dark secret and has joined the ranks of the undead and has apearently got the ability to return from death time and time again for fight his most hated foes...

The Wolfin are quick and dangerous predators that tear apart their prey with superior strength and their sharp claws. Rumour has it that the Wolfin are failed experiments between wolf and man but none alive now know the truth behind where these creatures came from.

Huge creatures made that are formed from rock and crystals wind their way through the Fire Gem Halls. These creatures are known as Crystal Worms and largely ignore the dwarfs who work here, however if intruders enter the halls the worms attack and repell them much to the Dwarfs delight!

The crocodile headed beings known in legend as the Sobek are belived to be linked with the power of water in this dry region. The Sobek champions have more arcane powers and have the power to raise the dead to serve them.
According to local legends the jackal-headed beings known as the Anubis are associated with the afterlife.

The Willow Nymphs are beautiful female creatures with skin that looks like a tree bark and have trailing leaves for hair. They are known to bewitch travellers to their doom with magic and other fey enchantments.

The Sepharom Halfspear arose because one faction kept loosing in battle. The champions figured out that they threw their spear at the enemy and were then left defenceless. They broke the long spear and handed it back the warriors and said 'If You return from battle without your spear, you shall be put to death.' This meant that the Sepharom had to fight in close, which they are very adept at.
Dune Howlers are a breed of howler dog. They get this name for the loud howls they can make. The Dune Howlers live in small hunting packs on the plateau that are often led by powerful alpha males.

The Orcs of the Crushing Fist Clan are huge Orcs that are well armored and armed with huge swords. The only thing that lets down these hulking Orcs is their relative stupidity. Apparently the Clans leaders are not planing any attack on the Halls. Some suppose they dont even know whats going on. Others thing they are more in the know than they let on...

The Blood Eye Clans warriors are blood thirsty bezerkers who weild wickedly sharp axes when they go to battle. The Blood Eye Leaders have a plan about taking the Warlord Title, To kill All the others who oppose them no matter how long it may take!

Clan Broken Fang have got a reputation for starting fights for no reason as they delight in combat no matter who it is with. It is roumored in the Orc camps that the leaders of the Broken Fang are desiding on the right time  to storm the Halls of Ko Lash and take the title of Warlord for themselves.

The Dark Blade Clan have a bad reputation with the other Orc clans as they are sneeky and dishonorable and would rather sneek up on an enemy and kill it than have a good scrap! The other clans are speculating that the Dark Blade are planing an assasination on Ko Lash, although no one can prove it.

The undead Dar GromSol Treasure Guard were in life the the top rank any guard can reach in Dar GromSol and they are hand picked from the best of the city guard to protect the citys treasures and secrets from any who would seek to steal them. Any caught trying to do so who dont end up dead in a battle with the guard are subjected to being burnt alive for their crimes.

The cellars were once infested with rats. To beat this a new type of snake was released to feed on the rats and solve the problem. However the new breed of snakes grew huge as they fed and their scales all but impervious to weapons used by the guard. They were then locked in the cellars. When the inhabitants were cursed to undeath the Snakes also befell the same fate.

One of Xinderoth's greatest weaknesses is his arrogance. The eye was his chosen symbol and he celebrates it in this creation. It is not known if Xinderoth can view what the Eye sees.  It is without doubt, that The Eye is purely an object of vanity.

Xinderoth Sarabaites are one of the orders of Doth. The Xinderoth Sarabaites are the highest order of Doth and have mastered Xind magic and the use of the deadly Doth blades. They are the most powerful mortals Xinderoth has under his control.

The ferocity of the Opticor Guard belies the comedic appeariance. It hunts down all who enter the citidel with endless energy. It is also said the Xinderoth can view all that the Opticor Guard sees through an orb in his secret chamber.
Kif the Lenzwer Druid is a mysterious man, and has been blamed by many for the creation of some unholy creatures that guard the forest such as the Root Monsters and the Mushcaria Beast.

Tales are told by travelers who pass through these lands of horrific beasts that were once simple Grofflesnouts but have been mutated by the evil magic of the Shadow Lord himself. They call this evil creature the Warped Grofflesnout.
The Elves once ruled the lonely Isle. The circumstances behind the Elves leaving are a mystery, however some vengeful spirits known as Elven Shades did remain to forever defend what was once theirs.
The Pirate Bosuns work hard on the decks of the pirate ships. They are a bloodthirsty lot and always the first to the fight!

The Isle is covered in the stone statues of warriors petrified by the creatures that live here. Some of the Petrified Warriors on the island have been re-animated by the Gorgons magic to act as warriors for them.

The giant beings known as Rock Colossus roam the Isle. Unlike the other re-animated stone warriors on the Isle the Rock Colossus were here long before the coming of the Gorgons and now serve the Gorgons and their leader Stheno as mighty warriors.
The Kreth Creeper's venomous bite paralyses and liquidises the insides of it's prey. They die in slow silent agony.

It is unknown where this weird creature came from. What is known is that it eats all it can find. Travellers speak of an odd slurping sound, and when they investigate strange gurgle in the dark, they find themselves fighting for their very lives.
The Minions of the Kreth Visage are hidious rotting undead creatures who serve the Visage and obey his every command.
The Troll Hold Guard are more curious about intruders than worried. It is beyond them why anyone would voluntarily walk to their death.

Old One Eye likes to have his back watched. That's one of the reasons he has lasted so long. He gives the Compound Goblins Guards only the finest weaponary and armour. This only makes the Goblins even more confidant and dangerous.
A slavering carnivorous plant that is under the spell of the Forest Hundras. The Guardian is always hungry, and  protects the Forest Hundras Village with total dedication.

The Qawi are highly protective of their lands. They have a harsh and bitter existence, they face dangers of the animals as well as the land it's self. The tribes avoid the edges of the ice for fear of a huge sea monster.

Many adventurers have braved these frozen lands in search of forgotten treasure. Unfortunately some never make it out and their spirits animate their iced-up armour. These sorrowful souls roam the wastes still looking for the riches in death that eluded them in life.
This gigantic beast hunts the depths of the Dread Claw Sea. Though the adolescent serpents are known to snatch it's prey from beaches and coastal areas.
Hemovores are beings that were once human but have now devolved into primative creatures who crave blood.
The savage Caprabeast defends the Crevasse with total vigilance. All who enter must face these violent and evil beasts.
The Carpabeast Mage is in tune with wild arcane energies that seep into the world from the Shroud. They are as talented as they are unpredictable. Travellers should not underestimate them.

The Undun were once creatures of evil that lived around the site the castle was to be constructed upon, so they were exterminated by the builders of the castle. Now the vengeful spirits of the Undun stalk the castle seeking revenge upon the living.
Doctor Morbidstein had the castle built by his personal workforce of lobotomized men. They are devoid of all emotions and free thought and serve the Doctors every need without question.

Doctor Morbidsteins greatest creations are known as the Sons of Morbidstein. He looks upon them as his own children and heirs. However they are unfinished and undeveloped, only time will tell how powerful such a creature will be when it is fully matured.

The Leopard Centaur culture is a loose collective of small savage tribes. They hold pockets of Ral Forest as hunting grounds which they patrol endlessly stalking hunting for prey. They see all animals as prey. This does include sentient the races.  The dedication to the hunt makes the Leopard Centaur a fearsome opponent. Most Elves of the forest simply avoid their hunting grounds.
These magical creatures have a touch of the Fey about them. They can charm anyone with their music and while they normally do this out of mischief,  ocassionally it is pure malice.

The Roots of the Forest of Ral are deep beyond measure, they reach unknown streams of pure water. From this the Treemen draw their strength. They do not allow any bar the Elves of Ralthien to walk the Forest Groves.

The Elves of Ralthien are proud and strong. The City has never fallen to an aggressor because the Elves test themselves constantly in the Forest around them. The savage wilds keep them from sleepy apathy.

The Ralthien Centaur were at one time a prosperous tribe until the Leopard Centaur moved into the Forest. The Centaur immediately found themselves at war with the powerful cats, who saw the Forest and wanted it for themselves. The Elves initially left the tribes to fight it out for themselves but when they saw that the native Centaurs were being exterminated by the invaders, they stepped in and allied themselves with them against the new aggressors. The Elves only forged the alliance with the stubborn Centaur under the guise of 'hiring' them and a promise to regain the Ancestral Centaur Tribal Grounds.

The taming and training a Dragon for use as a mount is very time consuming and dangerous. Therefore only the very rich can afford it. The Ralthien Kings of old have taken to having dragon Lords as Guards to their Palace Ward as both a status symbol and a statement of power and strength. Only the most talented and loyal fighters of the Elven Guards are chosen for the honour of wielding the Dragon Blade and riding so feared a beast.

The demonic shape shifters known as the Teotal Brujos are dangerous foes to come up against in the jungle. They have the power to shape shift into many dangerous creatures and are capable of using magics againt their prey.

The Spitting Cacti is a strange predatory plant that shows signs of intelligence and can slowly move after its prey. It kills its victims by shooting poison spines at them then moves to the sight of the kill where it absorbs the blood from the victim, storing it inside its trunk.

The Nagual are a shape shifting people. They are hard to identify when hiding within the communities of people living in the forests but they can change shape into animals in order to cause harm to others or to protect themselves, often a large dangerous animal such as a jaguar.

The Living Idols of Teocalli are the destructive products of curses placed upon some of the many gold Idols that adorn the passaged of the Teocalli of gold. The Living Idols wait patiently until an enemy passes them then they become active, smashing their foes asunder with mighty swings of their golden fists!

Light has always fascinated the Fae. They have a particular love of the cool beauty of Moonlight. The Moon Caster has the ability to draw this light into powerful darts that are said to have an unerring accuracy. They also seem to cast their spell on an instinctive level - so they don't just send one dart, but a hail.

The Fae Blade Dancer not only specialises in combat with a sword, but also reinforce their movement with their innate magic. One of the first talents learnt by any Blade Dancer is to magically armour their wings so they are not damaged in combat. This gives them the impression of blades. Many Blade Dancers use this confusion to their advantage, and tales of Fae with wings of swords have been spread by those looking for an excuse to explain being defeated by these tiny and deadly Warriors.

The Fae are a diminutive people. But what they lack in brute strength they make up for with their intelligence and magical abilities. This Fae rides a large Dragon Fly. It gains it's strength not only from the Dragonflies natural dexterity but also from it's magical armour and poison tipped lance.

Conceived by some mad experiment in an unknown laboratory, the Octo Sapiens are creatures shunned by its progenitors. These desperate beings now live a desolate life scavenging on the coastline and attacking others just to survive.

Chelonian Pirate raid these parts in their infamous battle turrets. They often come ashore to loot and pillage. Chelonian Pirates are confident fighters and are always eager to unleash their swords upon those who would fight them.

A zealot of the Death God, the Shroud Necromancers are to be feared and loathed. Only the most talented Sorcerers are chosen and these are put through unknown trials which make these hated magic users particularly potent.

Globsters are a strange type of crustacean that has a gelatinous shell on its back unlike that of other types of crustaceans. Globsters are slow but become surprisingly aggressive towards anything that comes too close to them, slashing at them with their razor claws.

It is unknown just where the Kahulla came from. But many suspect that Lishka has used her fearsome hexes on the Spirits of unfortunate souls. No one will know for sure, but the Kahulla has a single minded foucus on drinking the blood of all who dare enter the Atholu. The spirits of the women hexed must have been seeking terrible vengence on the world to result such unholy creatures.
Summoned from the darkness of the Sea, the Foulwater Demoness is a spirit of utter spite and venom. Their nature, a reflection of the Seas mercy.

Lishka always chooses men for her Bound Minions. These strange men are pale and drawn but their strength and cunning belies their looks. Lishka's favourite Minions have their life energy drawn from them to the point of exhaustion. But these are, ironically, the longest lived of all the Bound Minions.

Monks from the Dragon Scale temple use the wushu fighting style of the Scale. This form of wushu requires great strength and training with a steel staff. Scale wushu differs from other forms styles as it requires the monk to don a suit of iron hard armor, making the monk a powerful close combat adversary.
A Strange looking man that is able to wield weird Hexes seems to be using his powers in the strangest of ways. Not unlike a small child with a new toy, experimented to see what he can do.

As darkness sets, creatures known to the locals as the Zang Swords Woman come out of their hiding places to hunt the living. According to the local tales the Zang wear masks to cover their hideous Undead faces that have rotted away to the bone and that their swords store the essence of the unlucky people that they slay.

The Shroud Yaoguai are demon minions of the God GorGulGol. They are his demonic scouts and have been observed searching the forest. Although it is unknown what it is they are looking for, the presence of these servants of GorGulGol is not to be taken lightly as the Shroud Yaoguai are only ever sent on the most important of missions.

The Catacombs of Quan are guarded by ancient Terracotta Warriors. Deep within the the hard clay statue of the warrior lies the reanimated remains of one of Quans warriors, resurrected by necromantic magic to protect the catacombs for eternity.

The so called Amalgamated Spirit of Quan is an evil Undead horror that is created by many malicious spirits that have merged together into one being. this being seeks only to harm others and haunts the catacombs in search of prey.

The Fire Temple is home to a class of sorcerer known as a Pyromancer. These slightly unhinged people practice fire magic known as pyromancy. The Pyromancers are prone what is known as the fire madness, a condition where the Pyromancer becomes obsessed with arson and takes things so far as to even choose living things as a target for their fire spells.

The Nian is a horrible beast that normally dwells at the bottom of the sea. Often they come to the shore of the Kyoko Islands to hunt and it is said that the Nians favorite prey is young children, although none yet have been able to prove these stories.

Lustravias minions are many. These minions range tiny spiders to black cats and creepy imps, however her Dregs are the most common of her minions. The Dregs are considered the lowest of the low, some are mutants and others are just unlucky and simple and have been outcast from their homes and society. In return for Lustravias protection they help her in her complete her schemes and plans.

Living deep in the mountains are man-eating beasts known to the locals as the Theurang. These ugly one-footed creatures are surprisingly agile, jumping around the rocks in pursuit of their prey that they drag away to their caves to devour alive.

The Ussuri Tiger is an apex predator, it is at the top of the food chain and fears nothing. You won't know they are stalking you till it's too late. They go for the throat, dig their dagger like teeth and claws deep into the flesh of their prey and won't let go till it's dead.

The blood thirsty War Skull Pirates are infamous in these waters, led a group of Captains, they command a successful and vast pirate fleet that terrorizes settlements in the area and creates an all too common hazard for other ships that might enter the area.

The Falorn had many legends about undead creatures and the supernatural with the Soul Keepers featuring in many such legends. These beings of undeath were said to be the spirits of evil sorcerers that refused to truly die when their time amongst the living was over. The Soul Keepers got their name from their ability to steal the living essence from a person, thus denying the person an afterlife of their own.

These crazed greenskin creatures cast a sense of trepidation amungst its enemies. Scything claws and razor sharp teeth make the Grofflesnout one of the most feared greenskin creatures in Erildath. The Grofflesnout Brute is an even more deadlier version of the original Grofflesnout greenskin. Few survive the savage attacks launched by these deadly creatures.(Scavenging Creature)

The Ash Wolf is a solitary animal as prey is scarce in the wastelands and sharing its kills is not an option. It is a savage killer and will not hesitate in attacking prey many times its own size.(Scavenging Creature)

Deep in Elrill Dungeon dwell the Red Adhene. These dangerous fey are among the last members of the renegade Blood Cantnr. The Red Adhene are a shadowy people, hidden under their robes, none have seen their true form and have lived to tell the tale. They use strange fey magic, apparently delighting in transforming their victims into one of the many strange glowing orbs that surround the Red Adhene.

Murk Trolls live in the dirtiest areas of Eohlar and those who know this stay as far away from such places as possible. The Murk Troll is a well muscled greenskin, but thankfully has little intelligence in its ugly head other than the need to hit things and tear them apart with its bare hands and devouring what remains of its victim.

The Fiender is a demonic beast that has only recently been spotted in the forest. The Fienders are creatures of filth and poison and they gnaw the trees causing them to wilt and die. These Demons are said to have been sent by and evil force to cause destruction although who or what sent them remains a mystery even to the inhabitants of the forest.

Dark Radande are magical beings bound to the tree they were born to for the rest of the trees life. The Dark Radande are bound to trees corrupted by dark magics and other evil forces in the forests and have become evil beings capable of great harm to others as a result.

These massive brutes are native to the Barbmore forests. The Barbmore Ogres are a savage lot, wearing furs and trinkets taken from their defeated enemies. Heitwar looks to tame these creatures for his army as their savagery in battle is legendary. the champions of these Ogres proudly display the skulls of it's slain victims in a necklace around their giant necks.

Clad in heavy plate armor, the Guard of Heitwar are the backbone of Heitwar's army. Armed with an elegantly crafted curved sword, they have honed their skills with the sword to an almost unparalleled level. These particular soldiers are highly decorated, having achieved veteran status within the ranks through participating in several major campaigns.

The Heitwar Grunts are the most numerous of Heitwar's army, tasked with breaking through Eltwier's defensive line. The Grunts are a well trained unit, the units Champions are the most senior of the Grunts, often veterans of many of Heitwars battles and lead the units into battle.

These mischievous creatures are under the influence of Heitwar. They constantly harass Eltwier defenders from high above, hurling large rocks at the defenders below. It is often the largest of these creatures that are seen leading Winged Hellion flocks, it is thought that these larger Hellions are under the direct control of Heitwar.

Arid Dust Devils appear without warning near its victims before tearing them apart. Local scavenger tales say these winds are more than just natural phenomena and that an evil lies within the eye of the Arid Dust Devil. Often some say this is just a naturally strong wind. Others say a more powerful intelligence lies within.

Sewer Crawlers are sewer-dwelling arachnids that can grow to large sizes by feeding on waste that is found in abundance in the sewers, and are capable of surviving in this harsh environment thanks to its surprisingly high resilience to disease. Some Sewer Crawlers begin to grow spikes upon their carapace, these Crawlers are generally seen as being more vicious than usual.

Of all the trees in the swamp, none are as foul and evil as the Wailing Tupelo. These trees are hard to tell apart form normal trees in the swampy forests except for the evil faces wrought into the bark of the tree. The older Wailing Tupelo emits such powerful screams from its faces when someone in near,it can cause the explosion of its victim, leaving little more than a bloody stain in the swamp.

The Torgais City Guard are a highly trained group of soldiers that are payed directly by King Zelrokh. They are equipped with the finest weapons and armor that they can buy with their healthy wages. The richest and most skilled members are the Captains of the Guard, who give out the orders and keep discipline.

Tundra Lurchers are tall malnourished creatures that are cursed to be forever hungry. These relatively dumb beings roam Arkl in their permanent search for food, often devouring each other as they starve. Some Lurchers are gifted with larger claws and more brains that others, giving them an edge over others of their kind when it comes to getting food.

This demonic creature slinks stealthily within the dense forest, attacking anything that wanders too close. Nobody knows where these beasts originate from, as they are not native to the Blade Glades. The Lithe Demon constantly attacks nearby settlements merely for entertainment.
In contrast to their golden cousins, these Satyr have learned to tolerate other species within its habitat. However, these Satyr will protect their territory should they feel threatened in any way.
This winged beast dominates the skies of the steppes, swooping down to claim its prey. It's barbed tail is capable of cripping its prey while razor sharp claws tear apart meat.

The Winged Arachnid is a creature created by twisted magics, creating what is basically a giant flying spider. These creatures are only capable of short periods of flight and are not able to create a web like average spiders and so rely on surprise aerial assaults on their prey which they then devour as they catch them. Some Winged Arachnids have large pincers that inject venom into their prey, causing the victim to begin to decompose instantly. A gruesome death indeed.

Having been exiled from the Barren City for crimes against the harsh laws set by the Sultan, these men, many innocent and some not so, try to make their living within the desert. These men are often led by the strongest of their group or the most villainous. Both feared and respected by the other exiles, their rules followed closely or a fate worse than their exile will befall them.

The Vomit Crab has evolved to live in the wettest areas of the jungle. The crab ensnares its victims by vomiting a crippling venom on its prey. It's armored carapace is capable of shrugging off most attacks from the few predators it has. The Larger Vomit Crabs have large fiddler like claws that they use to defend their own kind from harm.

These undead soldiers were cursed aeon's ago by a powerful mage. The curse lingers to this day, forcing those affected Primal Guard from the grave to become undead creatures tasked with the guardianship of the ruined temple of Tor-Nok from invasion by the local Orc tribes. Some of the guard are more ruthless than others and brandish bone weapons that they use as clubs to crack the skulls of their enemies.

One of many tribes in the area, The Faetmor Orc's are very territorial and will slay anybody who enters their lands. The Faetmor Orcs are well known for their crimes against the Zinsaur and both races hate each other with a passion. The leaders of the Faetmor Orc's are brutal warriors that care little for personal safety as they rush their enemies with their wicked weapons.

Originating from the deserts in the far north, the Seiyrus has been tamed by the Zinsaur for their speed and agility. They are capable of lightning speed attack, rendering their victims dead before they are even aware of the beasts presence. The Seiyrus are pack animals and follow the strongest alpha male of the pack.
A vile minion of the Burning Hellion. These Imps do his will without question as long at it involves inflicting pain or destruction. More often than not his will involves both.

These individuals have been cast out of the Ethigor City for crimes or have simply left to get away from the restrictions of life in the city, and now take up permanent residence within the trees where many have taken up banditry and poaching as their careers of choice.
These deadly beasts are capable of burrowing beneath the ground. The ravager is capable of spitting acidic venom over its victims while massive scythe claws render apart prey.
This highly skilled Dwarven warrior rides on the back of a fearsome Warhog. At full charge, the Warhog itself is capable of tramping upon its foes.

These skilled Dwarven warriors are highly efficient with their throwing axes and know the caves like the back of their hands and often take up stealthy positions in the rocks where they wait for their enemies, stealthily picking them off with well placed throws of their axes. The Skirmisher champions are the best shots of the unit, rarely missing a target.

These beasts were imported from a distant unknown tropical land by shadowy traders. The creatures have come to be known as Hell Rippers for they have nasty demeanour's and the magical fires burning from their manes. The beasts were trained by the beast masters of the Muisru Kingdom to protect the dungeons from intruders. The rare Blue flamed Hell Rippers are more powerful and have since become the kings most favorite exotic pets.
These highly skilled mounted Dwarven warriors patrol the Tregdor streets, ensuring they are kept safe from any thieves, or even rioting locals.

The Chameletor is an ultimate ambush predator. This huge reptilian creature buries itself in sand, concealing itself perfectly into its desert surroundings ready to launch itself upon its victim with mind blowing speed and deadly jaws. Chameletors can live for hundreds of years and the oldest of their kind are huge scarred monsters, only getting bigger and more aggressive with age.

These massive arachnids are well suited to life in the desert and with their powerful legs they are capable of launching itself at prey from a considerable distance. The female Giant Degirusa Spider is easily identified as it has more body spots than the male but is also more aggressive and dangerous than the males

The Dimcriee Rocs Hatchlings are forever hungry, needing fed many large animals a day in order for them to grow large like their parent. The Dimcriee Roc Hatchlings stand as tall as a man and are already practicing their hunting skills, making them a vicious opponents even though they are young.

These highly skilled warriors were part of the Elmtor empire. These particular warriors were slain during a major battle hundreds of years ago. They were resurrected by a powerful creature with knowledge in the dreaded magics of necromancy. The Elmtor Warrior Champions are the most battle hardened of the Elmtor and are skilled in combat, even in their decomposed state.

The Riddergaul is a demonic harvester of souls, ripped screaming from its victims. The Riddergauls powers are said to stem from its demonic scythe and without this powerful weapon the demon would be starved of power, eventually fading out of existence. The most skilled of the Riddergaul are terrifying foes indeed, apparently able to drain the will to live from people with bit a glance from their fiery eyes.

These Orcs have built several small villages along this area. The Olcrani Savages use poison from local plants to coat their weapons and bodies when they go into battle as it makes them more dangerous. The Orcs love the danger of these forests but when there is a lack of dangerous beasts around to fight they often go and wage war against a neighboring clans village for fun.

This deadly species of plants is capable of growing at an incredible rate, carpeting areas of the swamp. Their most dangerous feature is the ability to "spit" a venomous liquid from its flower at entities nearby it considers a threat.

Encholic Tribes Men are fearsome warriors, coating themselves in the of their enemies and working themselves into a frenzy many an enemy flees them rather than fight. The Tribes Men are armed with a deadly curved sword coated in deadly poison milked from the Purple Cobra and a Bronze shield that bears the Tribes symbol. The most skilled and frenzied Encholic Tribes Men lead their men by example in battle, screaming and hacking their foes apart in combat.

Due to the rotting state of the forest, plague has set in and creatures of the area that have not fled fast enough have succumbed to a violent disease known to survivors as Dark Rot. A large clan of Ogres travelling through the forest have caught this disease, which leaves its victims in a zombie-like state. The longer the Ogre has been infected the more hideous it becomes, and the more immune to pain it is as its brain and nerves stop functioning.

The rare Black Stuori Bears roam the tundra looking for food. They are carnivorous and can easily chase down prey and overpower them with their great bulk, often dragging their prey long distances back to their dens to be devoured. The Black Stuori Bear are seen as sacred to the clans of the area who admire the strength and power of these beasts.

In the Snow covered Nualgiath Forests  travelers tell how they often feel they are being watched by a supernatural force, a hungry presence deep and unseen in the trees that is hunting them. This eerie power is accredited to the Chalbm Wolf,a large type of white wolf with strange hypnotic eyes. The Chalbm Wolf packs are often small but led by powerful alpha females who reside in the caves waiting for the pack to return.

The Goitha Axe Kazaki are the elite warriors of the city. These hard humourless men have been sent onto the streets recently as rumours of dark things entering the city spread. The Goitha Axe Kazaki Champions are the hardest of these men. Warriors of a hundred conflicts these men are capable of wielding their huge axes with great skill.

The Ratmen Slicers are known for keeping pet rats, that they gorge on the flesh of their enemies. Some of the Slicers are also breeders of a type of huge rat known as the Gigantic Rat. These rats can grow up to the size of a bull and are very dangerous creatures. The Slicers take great pride in breeding strange deformity's in their rats, especially ones that make them more dangerous to the enemy such as spikes or long claws.

Isopteran Soldiers are backbone of the Isopterans army. These creatures are well skilled with their weapons and tunnel fighting tactics but are said to fair badly when fighting in the open or on the surface. The best fighters of the Isopteran Soldier units are their Champions. They are born to be leaders and are marked with read heads and longer antenna so they can be spotted easily by the rest of the unit.

The Isopteran Royal Guard protect the queen and they will gladly die doing so. These warriors are powerful and armed with deadly spears and covered in and exoskeleton stronger than any knights plate armor. The Champions of the Guard are the only ones with direct contact with the queen and are often seen as being the personal bodyguards to the queen.

The Scared locals no longer go to the Graelen Graveyard, especially at night when the screams of the undead can be herd echoing through the night. The Screaming Skeletons are thought to have been resurrected by necromancy and the strongest of their number are the the former champions of Graelen.

Horrowal Dungeon has been abandoned for many a year, with both staff and prisoners alike fleeing the screaming horrors that moved into the Dungeon. These spirits were named the Banshees of Misery by the towns folk as their howl is painful to the ear. The most powerful of these spirits are said to have such a loud wail that they can cause eyes and ears to bleed...

The Knocker Warriors guard Underal with brute strength and their enchanted blades. The Warriors of Knocker society are even more malevolent that others of their kind and it is said that they are rewarded by the king of Underal for their evil deeds. The most mean of the Warriors will take charge over the others and are often armed with extra equipment or covered in gems given as rewards by the king.

The Ifrit Djinn are magic winged creatures of fire that hold the power to burn all in their path and the most powerful of their kind are said to be able to immolate the very air around them. The Ifrit Djinn are under the control of the evil sorcerer Koura and have been sent to destroy those he has foreseen in his Seeing Stone have come to attack him and stop his evil plans.

The Chara Dol Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Pass of the Fallen long before the bastion was built. The most powerful of the Wights are the Chara Dol Ice Wights, beings that are said to be able to freeze a man's blood with but a single look from their evil cold eyes, before cutting him dawn with their icy blades.

The Clan Skuggii are savage warriors from the cold lands of Scree. Many of the clan hire themselves out as mercenaries and have found a willing employer in the area. The Clans Juggernauts are titanic men of great power and the most powerful have been given magic amulets of enchanted ice by their employer. These enhance their power further and melt away if the Juggernaut is ever defeated.

It is said Mount Riangi lies far to the East from Helmirr but recently Dwarfs from this far away land had been seen in the Sapher mountains. The Dwarfs from Riangi are an evil lot that are said to work for a dark power. Their champions are well skilled warriors with their battle axes easily able to best any enemy to come their way.

The Knights of Holden are well known around the world as great mercenaries. The knights are secretive about their origins but it is assumed they hail from a secret keep in a far of land. The Knights Champions are the most skilled of these mercenaries and are well equipped for close combat fighting.

The Zekheld Terror is a foul smelling bat like creature. No one is sure when these creatures came to inhabit the wall. They are capable of gliding from their vantage points high in the arches of the dwarf architecture on their rudimentary wings as they search for prey to swoop down upon.

Of the many evil things that dwell in Dryidu the Degenerates are among the most disturbing. What the Dryidu Degenerates are or were is unknown although some whisper they are cursed dwarfs or some sort of mutated dwarfs cast down into the pit where they unfortunately have survived and multiplied.

Fire Elementals are beings born from the raw power of the element of fire. These beings take the form of an ever burning humanoid and dell in and around the Domain of Fire. Such is their power that only an Elementals opposing element is said to be able to destroy it.
additionalNotes: Requires item: Elemental Mask of Fire

description: Water Elementals are beings born from the raw power of the element of Water. These beings take the form of a humanoid made from rippling water and dell in the marshes around the Domain of Water. Such is their power that only an Elementals opposing element is said to be able to destroy it
additionalNotes: Requires item: Elemental Mask of Water

description: Earth Elementals are beings born from the raw power of the element of Earth. These beings take the form of huge hulking monsters of stone and other minerals and dell in the rocky ground around the Domain of Earth. Such is their power that only an Elementals opposing element is said to be able to destroy it.
additionalNotes: Requires item: Elemental Mask of Earth

description: Air Elementals are beings born from the raw power of the element of Air. These beings take the form of ghostly clouds that float around the floating island that makes up the Domain of Air. Such is their power that only an Elementals opposing element is said to be able to destroy it.
additionalNotes: Requires item: Elemental Mask of Air

description: Undead Drakes stalk these lands. It is said in books of magic that the spirit of Dragons is difficult to resurrect with necromantic magic, if not impossible. However the Undead Drakes have been resurrected and terrorise the land, blasting their victims with breaths of dark magic that strips them of flesh. Who or what resurrected the Drakes remains unknown...

The Spearmen of the Skar tribe are numerous and well trained for Orcs. In times of war great units of of these disciplined warriors march over the battlefield destroying all in their path led by their unit champions who keep order by bellowing commands and issuing the odd punch to their Spearmen if they fall out of line.

The Leghra Recluse is a species of giant spider that live in the the ruins, making giant webs where they take their prey, binding them in silk and feed on them. The Leghra Recluse is not a poisonous spider but is armed with giant fangs that it uses to capture its prey with.

The Fallen Paladins are a collection of once noble warriors who have fallen to the horrors of these dark tunnels. These once heroic warriors have been resurrected by necromancy and now are no more than zombies that shuffle around in the darkness waiting to feed on the living.

The Corrupt Revenants are the shades of evil men that seek to terrorize the living and are said to be able to drain the verry soul from a mans body as he screams in terror from an attack by a Revenant. These undead beings willingly serve those who command the Amulet of Souls so they can seek revenge upon those that come from the mortal world.

The Sephcan Heavys take the form of a giant suit of thick armor armed with an axe that is more than capable of hewing a foe in two in one swipe. Some eye witnesses to combats with these giants say that they are somehow in command of the the other warriors of the Sephcan, often directing them in battle and issuing commands in some unheard language.

The Riangi Dwarf Charger Champions are the evil leaders of regiments of Riangi Dwarf Chargers. These Dwarves are armed with huge re-enforced shields that they use to bash into their enemies with bone cracking force, and that's even before they attack with their battle axes.

Riangi Mines and slaves are controlled by the Riangi Mine Masters. These cruel Dwarfs treat their slaves with contempt and work them till they drop so that they can send a never ending supply of Riangi ore to the Inferno Abyss for their leaders secret needs.

The Great Dark Sea Octopus is one of the few creatures that leave the dark depths of the sea to hunt prey on the islands. These creatures are larger than normal Dark Sea Octopi and are cannibalistic, hunting other cephalopods as well as anything else they find to eat.
A Kutubu guardian of the Aspect of Rock. Why the Kutubu protect the Aspect with such devotion is unknown. They do not serve it as a deity, they simply kill anyone who threatens their charge.

A cunning Bonepicker with no thought other than making Gretcha number one in the Gomji. She has a formidable appetite for dealing pain and food and has great ambition for a Goblin, with her cunning mind constantly thinking on ways to make her tribe rich and powerful. Few dare to cross her.

The Deep has listened to the cry of Salshara and sent loyal Guardians from the sea to protect her from those who refuse to listen to the ancient wisdom. These Guardians take the form of powerfull water elementals and are blessed with ancient powers from the Deep.
Selling on the street is not easy, but these fast talking salesmen have got it down to a fine art. Everything they have is a rare find or an exotic treasure from far off lands - honest!

Stowaways on board the Barnacle Bandit are a dangerous lot, they will kill any who discover their identity and have apparently been releasing the ships slaves in a bid to cause disarray on the ship, where upon the stowaways can take control over the vessel.
Dead Dogs Islands is full of Scum. The worst of the scum here are murderers and robbers but most are petty thieves or just angry men on the lookout for a fight.

These crafty street urchins are not to be trusted. They are frighteningly good at finding weaknesses in your armour with their oddly sharp daggers. Many underestimate the Runners which is how they like it. It makes their opponents sloppy, and therefore an easy mark.

As a City Guard Captain Blackmore is responsible for his men and the stability of the City. He takes both tasks very seriously. But there are times when you need to watch whose feet you are stepping on, while you are doing your job to the best of your ability.
An expert in the art of War, the Martial Instructor gets the very best out of his Initiates. Whether they like it or not.
A Priest gives teachings of the Divine to the Initiates. This aids them is destroying the most evil of opponents. His methods are not the most conventional, but they are incredibly effective.

Mighty warriors and veterans of many battles aginst creatures of darkness, the Paladins are infused with the power of Light and blessed by their priests, often carying artifacts or weapons that are useful aginst evil. The Radiant Paladins strike fear in the hearts of all the unholy, for they know their time of evil upon the mortal plain will soon be at an end...

Not everything on the Mountain has fallen to the touch of evil. The Volmar Mountain Ram stands on the blackened soil, searching out the small hardy heather that still grows between the rocks of Volmar's desolate mountainside, protecting its own from danger with its horns.

The Champions of the Dark Horsemen are the most fearsome of fighters. Upon their armored Nightmares they cut down their foes with enchanted fire blades, gifted to the greatest of the regiments warriors by the Dreadlord himself.

The Spell Scarred Skeletons are the resurrected corpses of men that were once great magic users. Their bones are already infused with magic and the addition of a fire spell carved onto them turns them into deadly creatures capable of burning their foes to ashes with magical fireballs.

The Shades of Hunger are evil beings that feed on the very life essence of their enemies and becoming bloated by the power they absorb. These spectral beings will never stop feeding becoming huge and ever more powerful. The Dreadlord and High Liche Xpynor both use these Shades as reservoirs of power that they can leach upon to fuel their Necromantic spells.

Ancient ruins are common on the Quango Island and appear to have been built by an ancient people that worshipped the Quango birds. These people were masterful of magic and long after they disappeared their legacy still remains. Giant living stone guardians that are embodiment of the Quango Fire God guard the Chasm from any who dare trespass.
Pirates often stop by the Quango island to hunt the Quango Birds. These pirates are known as Quango Seadogs by the natives and are despised by for their greed and over hunting of the Quango young.

The Quango Mole is a giant carnivorous rodent that burrows underground. The Mole is not a dangerous creature normally but once colonys grow to large they can become enraged through competition with their own kind and go on huge feeding frenzies that can endanger populations of Quango Birds.

Due to their lust for blood and death, the Deathsabre has been honoured by the Dreadlord with enchanted armour that uses these destructive emotions to fuel the fires of their blades to burn the flesh of the living as well as cut.
Foul Shroud energies swirl around this enraged Ogre. These Ogres destroy anything that is not part of the cruel Clan that has claimed this inhospitable land as their home.

The Daco Bandits are the worst of scum to be found in the forest. Most are criminals and murderers from Karthak that have escaped the law. The most dangerous of these Bandits gather around them the like minded and organize raids on those travelling through the forest.

Daco Fairies are generally mischievous but they do have a darker side as many of the Fay do. There are many tales of the Daco Fairies using magical glamour to confuse travellers and send them in the wrong direction. The Fairies that have the most potent magic often take charge of the others, creating their fiendish plans and tricks to play on the unsuspecting.

The Highlanders are the citizen levey of clan Teuchter. Although not warriors by trade these grim people can more than handle themselves when it come to a fight using their spear, shield or even their own heads as weapons.The best of the highlanders are often the strong men of the villages such as the champions of the legendary Heilan games or other jobs that require great strength such as Logging.

The Drow are frightful Greenskins that prowl the cold caves. The Drow are lone hunters and man eaters who are said to delight in slowly skinning their victims alive before eating them. The larger more dangerous Drow generaly carry more bones and skulls as a sign of their power.

The Heilan Island breed of Haggis is a fearsome beast. The Haggis live on the rocky slopes that surround Loch Nis and have developed one set of legs shorter than the other to help them run round the slopes with ease, a defect that in no way hinders the beasties ability to hunt on flatter land. The haggis is sacred to the Islanders and on special occasions they may be hunted for their meat which is said to taste braw with a whiskey sauce!

The Shadowlords Minion is a mortal who has given himself, Body and Soul, to the Dark One. He has been tasked with the destruction of the Cathedral of Ways, as this is a central hub through which many powerful Warriors travel. It would allow his foes too easy a method of traveling to where ever his next assault may be and attempting to thwart his plans. The Minion has vowed to succeed where Burzzthak the Corrupter failed.

The Fachen is a strange creature with one arm, one leg and a single Cyclopean eye that is said to be able to kill a man with a single look. The Fachen hop around in the undergrowth in search of prey. The older Fachen often grow large antlers and bone spikes over their bodies that protect them if an enemy avoids their evil eye and trys to attack them in combat.

The Wulver live in family packs in the deepest parts of the forest. The Packs are lead by the strongest and oldest of their kind. They rarely come into contact with humans but many have recently been persuaded to act as guards for the castle gatehouse as better replacements for guard dogs.

Some of the more adventurous members of clan Teuchter leave Heiland Island to become Yeti Hunters. The demand for Yeti pelts and meat can make a high price in many of the far flung ports and cities of the world. The best Yeti Hunters often wear Yeti pelts to better hide them in the snow so they can sneak up on their prey.

droppedItems.itemName: Amulet of the Teuchter Yeti Hunter
Rune of the Teuchter Yeti Hunter

description: Glacial Giants wonder the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest Yeti legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.

The Frost Hippogryph is a strange mix of eagle and horse. These creatures normally only hunt in the highest peaks of the mountains but recently Frost Hippogryphs have been hunting in lower altitudes, preying on the flocks of Snow Sheep. It is known that fact that Frost Hippogryph stallion can be very aggressive if encountered.

The Cold Rusalki are malicious beings linked magically to the frozen ice that makes up their glacier homes. The Cold Rusalki despise anyone who would dare enter their domain uninvited and delight in freezing their enemies with icy blasts or impaling them upon icicles that erupt from their domains. Some Cold Rusalki are said to be powerful they can freeze the air around them or even their foes blood.
It's a Wild Turkey! Beneath those soft (and startlingly white) feathers and not-so-cute face is a tasty, tasty bird! This one however refuses to go down without a fight!
These fellows are simply trying to help the Striking Workers by organising them.
A snow fox. It has superbly white fur that's terribly soft!

The Deep Coelacanth is close relative to the Giant Coelacanth. It is a horrific giant fish from the deepest area of the sea however like its cousin it can survive some time on land. The Deep Coelacanth can use its fins like legs to push its scaly body over the ice to catch slow moving prey before returning back to the darkness to digest its meal.

The bird like Sirens of Steinnheim sing songs with their magic tainted voices to lure ships to their doom on the island where they fall under a spell and become easy prey for the Sirens. The most flamboyant Sirens generally sing the most powerful songs, and thus are more likely to ensnare more prey than the others.

The Einherjar are warriors whos skills in combat far outstretch those of mere mortals. These lone warriors are said to have transcended death and been brought back from the afterlife so they may once again fight and hone their skills. Some Einherjar are said to have left the path of becoming better warriors and have become debased, seeking new ways to torturer and maim their victims rather than outright kill them in combat.

Dark Valkyries are evil women warriors who were cast out of Sea King society for their crimes in evil magics and rituals. The leaders of the Dark Valkyries are said to dye their hair with the blood of their enemies, a practice they believe will make them more powerful in battle.

The Trun Smiths are constantly at work making arms for the warriors since the mines accidentally uncovered the unknown underground Slyvins realm and started a war. The oldest Smiths often have rune etched tools making them better at forging weapons and also cracking skulls.

The caves here once were home to the now extinct Wyza. These Giant Cobra-like serpents were hunted into oblivion by the Slyvin as sacrifices to their great god Zaq. Now only the angry spirits of the Wyza exist. These Spirits are as much a threat to the Slyvin as they are to anyone else.

Halflings are a kind people by nature, more concerned with having a nice meal, growing their crops and looking after their animals than fighting, however some Halflings have banded together and are intent in taking back what they can from the Gozoid who took over their homes. These Rogue bands are led by the most brave Halfling's in the group.

The Pigool is a special species of Halfling bred pig. The Halflings farm these animals and make good money selling on the meat to travellers as the pork of the Pigool is said to be some of the best in the world. The Pigool Boars are protective of their own and with their sharp tusks will defend other Pigool fearlessly.

The Dark Warlocks of Myagar draw their powers from a series of glowing green crystals of set into their staffs. The powers these crystals grant is great indeed and the Warlock can use them to conger up great magical blasts that can vaporize a man or worse...

The Bone Tooth is a small but potent Clan of Ogres. They have a instinctual connection with what they call their Watching Dead. They believe that those who fall in battle give their strength to those of the Clan who need it. This means that at points in a fight the Bone Tooth can suddenly manifest powerful Elemental energies to crush their foes.
These formidable warriors closely guard Lord Shuito. Chul bodyguards are well equipped to deal with any threat, while being highly proficient at thwarting any attempts at slaying their lord.

A Goblin riding a large Volk whoops in delight as he rampages through the Cymru with surprising speed and competence. They don't seem to be hunting any prey, but rather driving wild Emperor Volk into the Depths of the forest for some reason known only to themselves.

Ornildon has heard the whispers of the Eryri forest for Centuries. As the ages past the wood honoured the Druid with an extended life and he has served the woods faithfully for as long as he can remember. He saw the purity of the wood tarnished by the construction of the vile Chul Fortress, and his anger burned. But Eryri calmed his rage and assured him that in time the harsh stones of the Chul Castle would be shattered and returned to dust. He slaughtered all Chul Soldiers that entered the Forest and they soon learned to fear the power of the trees.

The Shuito Termite Kings are even larger and are far more voracious than their lesser brethren. Their wicked mandibles have the power to slice through the largest of trees (and doughiest of Warriors) in a single bite.

The recently revealed Zargonian Ratmen are all quite stupid. They are possessed of a crude animal cunning but the Sorcerers have been taught a base form of magic. They appear to be controlling their lesser brothers though they themselves are more than likely being used themselves.

The Drow Hawk Riders are used as the Lorsillian vanguard. They are the scouts and skirmishers of the Drow force, superbly fast and agile. The Hawk Rider Captains are the very best of the Hawk Riders. Skilled with a lance that doubles as a javelin, they reaper a heavy toll on their enemies.

The Hand Maidens serve their Warmaster in every way. Whether it is bringing him food or killing those who displease him in court. Fast, nimble and very, very deadly, these are hand maidens you do not want to cross!
The Lorsillian Drow Training Masters are in the process of re-educated their errant people in the art of paying their respects to their ancestors.They relish an extra challenge then.
Ratman Vanguard Leaders are in command of the Ratman Vanguard. They seem brighter that most Ratmen but still incapable of this level of battle smarts!

Thornvine Dryad Warwitch is a much more powerful type of Thornvine Dryad. Unlike their sisters, they are rarer though they make up for this with a staggering grasp of natural woodland magic and an incandescent rage which dwarfs even their sisters anger over the damage done to the local woods.
