Tribes of Orc Headhunters swarm the Island. The Orcs who are the best at taking the heads of their foes are often the leaders of their tribes. These Greenskins often adorn themselves with the skulls of their most powerful enemies as trophy's.

The Gaap are Demon soldiers that patrol the coast of the Tainted Isle with their demonic tridents. The Head Gaap are the most powerful of their kind and it is said they get their orders directly from whoever their mysterious leader is.

The reef supports a huge amount of sea life that live deep in caves within the coral. The Ridged Gymnothorax is one of the most dangerous of these animals and has a venomous bite. These Giant Eels often hunt close to the surface looking for prey. Thankfully these poisonous terrors are quite rare.

The Priests of Gnok are the leaders of the tribes on the island. They lead the cult of Gnok and to appease their living god they sacrifice those captured to the one they call the Son of Gnok whom the tribe believe sits at the right hand of Gnok himself who apparently dwells in the deepest area of the jungle.
It is unclear if this is one spirit or many. But what is obvious is that the Bone Hail sweeps through the Elya Fortress venting it's murderous anger on anything it finds.

This Elven Vampire oversees the Blood Rite and guides the Neophytes in the journey into undeath. When the Neophytes consume a bone of the Elya Guards, Karnas gives his blood, sealing the Vampire Curse, giving a temporary boost to the newly created Vampire Apprentices. The Mark of Karnas is a token that shows the Rite has been completed correctly.
From the Dreg tar pit the Tarnitch crawls in to the halflight of the Swamp, it devours the Dreg Lights to fuel the fires within.

The Umbar Fanatics have embraced their new 'god' wholeheartedly. They seem to be content to rampage through the Realm, killing all humans not of their tribe! Their most fervent are wearing masks instead of bandages. Are those horns part of the mask?
The Hell Spider Brood Queens are the primogenitors of the swarms of demonic arachnids that haunt this level of the caverns. They dwarf their offspring in every way!
The Greater Magmasaur is, as you'd expect, an even larger version of the normal beast. It will attack and devour anything it comes across, even lesser Magmasaurs!
Umbar Deacon Elders are more fanatical than their lesser brethren. Their skill with their glaives is superb. They chant to their 'Lord of the Shadow' and the 'Divine Dragon Overseer' as they fight.
These Miners have been hardened by toil and pain so that their skin is almost as tough at the rock they carve.
This Demon delights in snuffing the life light from anyone it finds. The Valgotic Dwarves have tales of the Gas Demons drinking the souls of their victims.
This talented Warsmith has etched advanced armour and defensive runes into their battle staff. One should expect a long fight with this tough opponent!

Judging from the fine armour and sword this undead was probably a elite swordsman in life. But whatever he was in the past, he now eternally drags his greatsword mindlessly through the Thangall trees.

The hungry dead roam the ravaged streets of Atrum Town. Some enterprising adventurers have sought to take from the riches of Atrum. Most never leave and they now forever protect the town they once tried to loot.

The Lord of the Zendell Keep rewards the strongest and most brutal of his Trolls with the best food and armour. This encourages the Trolls to even greater savagery on the battlefield, which not only terrifies their enemies but bolsters the other Trolls as well.
The boiling battle rage of the Swordsmaster fuels his strength and endurance in combat. One should think twice before meeting this man in single combat.
This powerful curse is drawn to a particular soul. Fleeing from it will delay the inevitable, the only escape from the Curses remorseless hunt is death.

Even the cows are not immune to this plague of undeath! The Atrum Zombie Dairy Cow is roaming the pastures, grazing on any living creatures they can catch. They also make do with the corpses of creatures that have died a true death. They are creating a nasty, poisonous smelling fluid in their udders now, which the Milkmaids are gathering.

The Townsfolk of Dyseki are dead. They were wiped out and have been raised as Skeletons and had all flesh dissolved from their bones with the zombie cattle milk. Magic keeps them moving and without the clinging flesh slowing them down, they have become swift and merciless hunters. The Townsfolk Elders were fairly powerful mages. It didn't save them. They have come back and retain full knowledge of their powers and are using them for their new master.

An embodiment of the raw power of the world, these fiery spirits normally dwell far beneath the realms surface. For the Flame Naiads to sustain themselves away from the worlds heat, they need to drink the emotions of hate and rage from creatures around them.

Herds of Razox roam the tundra of the Ungla Mountains. Razox Bulls are huge creatures and are very protective of the herd. A charge from a Razox Bull is generally fatal as they crush their enemies with pure strength or cut them to shreds on their razor sharp horns.

Lash Skolex are giant horrible worms that gorge themselves on the bones and corpses of creatures killed in the pass by Rubble hunters. The Lash Skolex is not adverse to hunting for itself when opportunity arises, using its long venomous tongue to stun and drag its prey towards its grotesque fanged maw to be eaten.

Ancient tales have said the the Black Hart is a omen of change for whoever sees it. If it is slain, the reasons for the hunter killing the Black Hart colours the omen. A Hunter who kills the Black Hart out of desperation will be blessed with good fortune. Should the Black Hart be slain out of greed, the Hunter will be cursed until the price for the spilt blood is paid.

The Blind Hags are a coven of witches that live deep in the Terror Forest. Although blind they can see through magical aids like crystal balls and other talismans they carry. The most senior Hags are in charge of what spells and potions are created and their ancient knowledge in such magic is great indeed.

These formless vampires appear as only a blur in a roughly human shape. The only features that can be picked out are their blood red eyes and a fanged mouth. These ghostly creatures prey upon the living. The more they feed the more corporal their form becomes. the most powerful Blurs have already begun to grow bones and even organs within their shadowy bodies.

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their enemies. The largest of the Honbucks normally lead the herd and are more likely to confront a foe.

Spitting Lizards dwell in the sand dunes. These reptiles are quite weak and find it hard bringing down prey in the vast open areas of the desert so they have evolved the ability to spit out jets of venom at their prey that burns and weakens the victim, making them easy prey. Even if they did not make the kill the largest spitting lizards always get to eat first by bullying others.

The Vipesh Shamen are ancient creatures who live away from Vipesh society and even their own people do not seek them out unless the need is dire. Here in the silence of the marshes they contact their evil god Voresshh and devise foul spells. Some Shamen are closer to the other side than others, drawing powers directly from dangerous realms. These Shamen burn with demonic power.

The Vipesh are a race born of evil. They are a cold blooded snake people at home in the steaming hot jungles worshiping their evil god Voresshh. The Vipesh scouts protect the borders of the river and the Vipesh lands with poison arrows from their bows. The most senior Vipesh command the scouts for their experience is invaluable in such dangerous jungle.

The Deadaxe Orc tribe are mercenary that are now under the pay of Xerdes. Few men would ever have dealings with such dangerous greenskins but Xerdes knows the value of such troops and uses them as the spearhead of his army.the strongest of the Orcs are the leaders of these greedy evil mercenarys and get the highest pay and best loot from battles.

Xerdes has many loyal supporters in the city of Lacedon. These tend to be of an unsavoury character and many have been paid to silence supporters of the king in underhand ways. These rag tag groups normally centre round a gang leader who organises the Loyalists activity's and crimes.

Daedus had wizards enchant pools of lit oil in the Labyrinth with magical life. These Living Fires still burn today, moving with a life of their own and attacking and smothering any who enter their vicinity with a gruesome fiery death. Some of these Fires seem to burn brighter with enchantments than others, changing the colours of flame and increasing their power tenfold.

The dead do not rest well in the Labyrinth and many a fallen hero who never got to finish some forgotten quest into this dark place still stalk the pathways. Some of these heroes are still clad in their own personal enchanted armor and carry rare kinds of weapons and shields as would be a common sight on such heroes and are mighty opponents indeed.

The Violet Silencers are magical adepts of a secretive order. None have ever spoken ever and none outside their own knows their mission or what their order do. The most senior Violet Silencers wear magical hats that are said to give them even greater powers than their brothers. However if it is true then this extra power just lets them use disintegration spells faster than normal!

The Sword Sage are warrior wizards that garrison Rillians Tower. Each is an accomplished magic user they use their magic to aid them in combat against Rillians enemies by confusing them or slowing them down with magical hexes. The Champions of the Sword Sages are armed with Hexed swords that glow with an unearthly light, it is said these swords can bypass armor as if wasn't even there.

The pirates on the coast are not the only ones out for plunder, the Mattix Scavengers are a hardy lot that rove in bands over the beaches killing zombies and the undead to loot the corpses. The men who lead these bands are as ruthless as any pirate captain, and they take great delight in using any enemy they capture as bate for zombie hunting...

Pirates and Corsairs are not the only sea going enemies on the Dead coast. Skeletal Mariners from the infamous Skeledog ship raid the coast too, but unlike the other scum of the sea the Skeletal Mariners are only interested in looting the souls of those they kill. The raiding groups are normally commanded by the strongest of their number, normally the one who has captured the most souls out of them all.

The Death Abnegated were prisoners here when the dungeon still functioned. They died in alone in their cells but part of them refused to cross over to the other side, still hopeful of rescue, release or revenge. Some of these ghostly spirits have less of a grasp on reality than others and have been known to murder and hunt down any who enter the dungeon in mad rampages.

A foul creature that dwells in the blackest areas of the dungeon. None know where the Screaming Spawn comes from and none really want to find out. Some of these spawn are so mutated that if it wasn't for their screams it would be hard to tell exactly what it was behind the writhing tentacles and extra mouths.

Ogzog Orc Warriors assemble within the muddy courtyard of their stinking hold Ogzoggin. The Warriors of the Ogzog tribe are well armed with the finest of the looted and stolen wargear that can be taken. The leaders of the tribe Orcs go to war with them as their champions and to insure that the battle plan is followed and they don't go wondering away or attack the wrong the targets.

These are desperate times for the Bunkyners, and some have secretly taken matters into their own hands and begun to seek their own help by dabbling in forbidden magic and raising a saviour that will destroy the Orcs once and for all. Only the most learned of the cultists can carry out the most complex of the rituals of summoning, mostly because they are the few of the villagers that can read.

Foul smelling and caked in filth, the Snorg Spoilers reek of evil and death itself. They were sent to despoil the works of the good wizard Handrix. Magic protects the tower from fire and destruction so the Snorg decide to besmirch the inside with their own filthy fury.

The Snorgs are beastmen from far away mountains that have banded together in whats known as a Snorgherd to take the city of Grokhiem. The job of the Snorg Wreckers within the herd is to terrify the citizens into submission with violence and acts of property destruction. The leaders of these groups of Snorgs wield large stone Maces to further their efforts in destruction.

Snorg Fiends are the most cruel members of the Snorgherd. These cruel Beastmen are rounding up Grokhiems citizens for use as slaves or worse. The most cruel and evil of the Fiend find much delight in using wicked looking cat-o-ninetail whips. They are well known for their overuse of these whips on prisoners.

Magma Centaurs are bestial creatures with the upper torso of a man and the head and body of a Magma Lion. These are not noble creatures, more content with stalking prey in the plains and brawling with others of their kind. Magma Centaurs are led by the strongest of their kind, the ones who win all the brawls and bring the biggest kills back home with them.

The plains are often swept with hot volcanic ash storms. It is within these storms that the feared Mares of Doom charge from. These horse like creatures made from the very ash of the storm and the stronger the storm the more powerful the Doom Mare within it. The strongest of these storms are said to be able to cook a man alive in his armor or seer his flesh from his very bones!

The albino Athornts are large crayfish like crustaceans that live in this large underground lake. These creatures are blind and rely on their sensitive feelers to catch prey, which is usually anything not fast enough to escape its claws. Although it is rare, some Athornts grow old and their natural armor becomes thick and covered in horns and spikes. This makes an aged Athornt a hard enemy to crack.

The Honga are ghost like earth spirits. Peaceful creatures generally, the only thing the Honga hate is those who despoil the earth and steal its minerals and dig it away. This wrecks the Hongas perfect view of the ground they drift through like a sea. Any Man, Elf or especially Dwarfs that mine the ground is an enemy, and don't get them started on armor and weapons made from ore...

Strange beings of blue live in the very ice itself. Some local legends describe them as the magical embodiment and living will of the ice or even the mountain itself. Whatever the truth these beings have power over the very snow and ice itself. The most powerful of the Snow Callers can call upon lumps of ice and rock to hurl at foes or even blizzards of razor sharp icicles that shred and freeze.

The Sherpan are buried in the icy glaciers natural tunnels by the tribe, seen as mystical pathways for the chosen of the mountain god. These bodies normally freeze solid and become one with the glacier, but there are some cases of the corpses returning from the dead to haunt the tunnels. The most powerful of these corpses have a frozen aura around them that can freeze their victims solid.

The Jordo Mages are naturally gifted magic users. Using their powers to control the seasons they can insure the conditions here will always be favourable for the Ice Elf way of life. The Greatest of these Mages are employed by General Ydmar to enchant demons to his will and create special guards for him from magical ice.

Jordo Infantry are the rank and file troops of the city, these grim troops are well versed in killing warm bloods with their long swords. The Champions of the infantry units are veterans of many conflicts with warm bloods and lead the units of Infantry into battle.

The Boroka are terrors of the sky, more fearsome than the storm itself. These unnatural creatures resemble black winged horses but with the face of a screaming fanged woman. They hunt for those trapped on the islands to feed upon. The strongest of these terrors also have the longest manes. These winged beasts lead herds of Boroka when hunting.

The Tempest and Stormcall Dracs work alongside the Mason Dracs, these highly skilled builders have had centuries to perfect their craft. The Masons have begun to build the series of pillars and other buildings the others have planned. These structures are needed to syphon magical power into the portal. The Masons are more than capable of fighting those who might sabotage their work with blows from their hammers and picks.

Skull Familiars are foul creatures of dark magic that Xerdes has summoned to amplify his spell casting. It regains it's energies by drinking the blood of the living, the more it drinks the more powerful Xerdes' spells become.

The Enraged Blackness are shadow like beings with a roughly humanoid shapes who  stalk the plain. These Demons have only one feature that can be picked out from their black form, a screaming mouth. The strongest of their kind can utter dark magic curses in their terrifying Demonic language, the affects of these curses can be deadly to any who hear them.

The Chosen of Pythius have been hand picked by Pythus to serve in the armies of the Shadowlord in the mortal world. Although picked from one of the many kinds of Demons in the Plain they have all been given new form in the shape of horned knights in black armor. These Demonic warriors are led by the strongest,oldest  and most violent of their kind.

Wargorz Champions are the leaders of the Wargorz clans. these huge imposing beasts are skilled bushmen and warriors and are more than capable of defending their people from slave taking attempts by the Skorpinok.

Skorpinok Brutes are the strongest of their kind, these giants patrol the mines keeping everything in check and squashing any who get out of line with their huge stone clubs. Some of the Brutes are covered in stronger exoskeletons than others making them more resilient in a fight.

Capcauns are huge brutish creatures that dwell in caves in the area. The Capucun are ogre sized beings with snarling dog like faces that carry clubs which they squash their prey with. The Capucaun are addicted to eating humans and if the scent of man is in the air they will travel long distances to find and devour the unfortunate person. The most savage of the Capucaun are so addicted they go as far as attacking their own kind in a frenzy in order to get at human flesh. As such they are shunned by their own brethren.

The Skharik are a diminutive Gnome like people that live in this dangerous land. little is known of them as other except that they live in hidden underground towns and distrust strangers. The Skharik are also well versed in Geomancy, using these powers to use the very earth around them to assail intruders and enemies. The leaders of the Skharik are said to be the most powerful of the communities Geomancers.

Mamont Warriors were the most powerful warrior the Closine Clans had These skilled warriors rode to war atop huge bull Mamonts crushing and killing any in their paths. The Most powerful warriors of their clans were also the clan leaders, men of great skill and strength. Although now undead they still lead their people to war.

Observations on the Tarmen show that the most powerful of their kind appear to be the so called Bone Tarmen. These large Tarmen are seen directing others around although it is not known what plans they have. The Bone Tarmen have many Mamont tusks and other bones stuck in their tar like bodies that make for good weapons when needed.

The Kroba tribes are ruled over by Warlords, the most skilled of the Krobas warriors and are said to have been chosen by Kulock to be leaders. They are marked out in battle by their warpaint and trophy racks that display the skulls of fallen enemies, a testimony of their skill in combat and a warning to others.

The Nzumbe Mistar are the crowning achievement of Papas voodoo use, captured people marooned on the island he successfully transformed them into more Demon than man using specialized and dangerous possession spells. These Entities have formed Papas bodyguard and are bound to die protecting him.

Shadow Hanbi dwell in the deep dark passages in the ziggurat. These skull faced fiends constantly recite the 1000 curses of Akkazariorn Rah. To hear even part of one of these curses can cause your blood to boil or skin to blister and ultimately lead to a horrifying and painful death.

The Azuzu of the Fold use demons that have taken the form of giant Hawks to guard their secret temples within the Ziggurat. These demonic birds react to intruders with their unnaturally fast reflexes, driving away or killing the intruder with their toothed beaks and razor sharp claws.

The Giant Sea Snake does not live exclusively in the sea, but is most at home there hunting large fish, dolphins and other large monsters of the deep. When not at sea they live in coral caves along the coasts side. The venom of these serpents is not that powerful but when you're as large as a Giant Sea Snake it doesn't have to be.

The Chodrmen are a race of Shark people that live deep under the sea, often coming to the islands to hunt or battle with Corallians. The Saw Chodrman are among the strongest and most deadly of their kind. Naturally armed with a huge saw-like nose, they can wield it with terrifying skill in battle slashing at foes within reach. Any not caught by the ripping teeth of the saw will be attacked by the twin tooth blades the Chodrman also carries.

The Razored Armorpod is a huge kind of Ispod. These slow moving beasts graze the island protected from predators by razor sharp segments of their shell that will easily slice open any that try and grapple with the Armorpod.

Hydrapedes are horrors to behold, twisted by dark magic they resemble multiple centipedes fused together to a larger body and in many ways resemble an insect-like Hydra. With so many mouths to feed, the Hydrapede is forever hungry and rarely stops hunting.

The Elephus Bahamut is a giant species of man-eating fish that has a long trunk atop its fanged mouth. These strange-looking creatures are covered in horny scales that are stronger than steel and are said to make fine armor for those who can get them. They use their trunk to grasp prey from the shore or boats and once caught in their grasp there is no chance of escape.

The Quooth are a fractured tribe of human cannibals that reside in these dangerous lands, preying on each other and anything else they can find. The Quooth Sodorg are the leaders of the tribes. These important Quooth are given the best meals and best cuts of meat that the tribe cook up. They are also feared by their tribe members for it is the Sodorg that choose the target for the next meal, and when pickings are slim it could mean they pick from the tribe people themselves...

Deep in these dark forests live Black Deer, not unlike the Deer of other lands except their hide is as black as pitch. The Kingstag's rule over the herds of Black Deer in the forest and viciously protect them. These huge Deer are larger and more deadly than any of their kin and a charge from their antlers is bound to prove fatal.

Gray Hag Queens are powerful witches that are in charge of The Gray Hags sisterhood. The Queens form a council that controls the actions of the sisterhood and its targets. The Queens are ancient crumbling beings that have lived for centuries in the ruins thanks to their strong magical powers, and may have even been responsible for this civilisations destruction in the first place though none can know for sure.

The Verm Corvus is a terror of the sky, resembling a massive crimson raven the size of a horse cart, with a wing span longer than a house. It hunts the Great Corvus in the heights of the mountains but since they descended upon the town to feed, the Verm Corvus have followed bringing their terror upon the citizens of Caruftun!

The Necral were an ancient tribe that lived in the mountains, dabbling in dark magic and worshipped evil gods but have since died out. Often in the caves, the Necrals greatest warriors known as the Haunters will rise as a result of their dark magic rituals. These warriors were buried in the finest of bronze armour and  with the best of weapons and are a dangerous foe to behold.

The Erlatay are beings from the ancient world long trapped in the ice of the Glacier. These beings have somehow lived through the millennia and some still carry dreaded and ancient diseases on them, diseases that should have died with these ancient beings but still crawl upon their ravaged flesh. Getting to close to these Erlatay is to invite a painful death through infection .

Ancient Demons that were trapped in the Glacier since its formation, the Green Bakab are the minions of the the fallen God Blacksun. Since the formation of the Randkluft cracked open their icy prison and freed them and the fallen God the Green Bakab have served as powerful protectors of the ritual, ensuring none disrupt their Yellow brethren as they prepare to exalt their lord.

The Garnet Auganiton are ancient beings found in the depths of the world. They are of a roughly humanoid form shaped from rock. Where its head should be lies a large stylised eye shape made from deep red garnet crystal.The Garnet Auganiton seem to be the leaders of this rocky race, and seem displeased that uninvited guests are in their tunnels.

Moleman Destroyers are well built for such a feeble people that live squatted in the tunnels of the hive. They carry huge hammers for braking rocks for minerals and  the bones of any surface dwellers that intrude the hive.

Weeping Swampman are almost humanoid beings that shamble through the swamp. They resemble nothing much more than a large mass of rotting swamp plants, roots and mud. These Swampmen make crying noises and their eyes glow with an unearthly light. Local legends say these beings are fuelled by the souls of those who die lost in the fens and as a result have magical powers that can slow its prey from escaping its deadly grasp.

Eagle Owlbears are huge brutes that are active hunters day and night and completely carnivorous. They are legendary for being relentless in their pursuit of their prey, happily running for days, even out of the forest and into the marshes of the Zhang Heath if they must!

Spitting Deathworms live just below the ground, waiting for prey to come past their burrow. Once prey has been detected they rise up from the burrow and spit a jet of highly dangerous venom at the target. This venom blinds and burns the victim, making it an easy kill for the Spitting Deathworm.

The Po were a proud warrior civilisation that fell to ruin, their descendants are the Zhaghu horseman of the plains. The ruins of the Po are said to be cursed and ghostly Po Drauger Wraiths still dwell here. Said to once have been sorcerers or men of great magical power in the Po society these Wraiths still retain some magical skill in death.

Khalon Riders are the most revered warriors of the Khalon tribe. These privileged and skilled warriors ride upon tamed Deinotherium mounts that are almost as dangerous to tame as they are in battle! As the tribe worship the Deinotherium as a great protector they also see the riders as one with their mounts, as holy warriors sent by their great land god to protect them.

Sand Goblin Chiefs are the leaders of the Sand Goblin clans that swarm the dunes. These leaders are little better than others of their clan and have gained their position of power through treachery and bribes. These self important characters full of themselves and dress accordingly but also have access to the clans best war gear and poison it with desert spider venom accordingly.

The Sloclorin are an ancient race of treemen that live in harmony with the forest around them. The Ancient Sloclorin are the leaders of their people and are as old as the forest is, indeed many remember when their was not much forest here at all. These slow beings rarely move unless they have to, preferring to ponder the meaning of trees and give wise council to their people.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. Pine Hypeezles live high up in the trees where they wait for prey to wander below them. When such a target comes by, they jump from the tree and with precision they land upon what will quickly become their next meal before retiring to the trees again.

The Dark Alfadl are a race of evil Elves from the cold far north. The Dark Alfadl Nightmares are mounted warriors that ride atop well built steeds whos hides are as black as their riders souls. These well armed warriors patrol the rugged terrain of the forest.

The Dakenborn are the lords of the Dark Alfadl and they lead the armies and are integral to the meeting between the Dwarfs and the Shadowlords emissary in the fortress of Zator. Their children are known as the Drakenborn Sons and are the next in line to lead their people. The sons are all excellent warriors, having had the finest training and all are armed in the finest of armor and weaponry.

When a Black Knife fills his dark knife with notches they can make challenge for leadership. This is done before the entire clan of Black Knives. The victor leaves the fight with his heart still in his chest and their opponents Black knife as a trophy.

The ruler of the dark Dorthan Forest. Tales do not tell of her name, some say she herself has forgotten it. Although what is in no dispute is that she cloths herself in dark and forbidden magic's which are fueled by the souls of the living.

A noble protector of Crestoun. The Crestoun Guard swear an oath to lay down their lives to keep the citizens of the coastal town safe from all dangers. The Guard serve their city with honor and strength.

The Keepers are an old order that is responsible for maintaining the Wards of Light which protect Crestoun from plague and illness. Recently the Keepers have been assailed by weird thoughts and  hallucinations which endanger the very sanity of these powerful mages.
The mind of this talented and potent mage has been ripped apart by the diseased whispering of the Old Ones. They are now just an empty vessel for them to fill...
These protectors of Thantrathull guard their prophet with their very lives. Their robes have been enchanted by the Old Ones, which wards and empowers the Acolyte against all enemies.

With a bit of practice the lyrics to the Tome's mantras begin to trip off the tongue and even pictures can manifest of a strange world filled with otherworldly creatures. No one quite knows where the Tomes come from, but that all part of the thrilling mystery of it.

A crude image of the wondrous Blood Weaver. The Weaver has sat on the Court of the Old Ones before time began, his gift is shaping flesh. One should take great care when approaching such an artifact as the Weaver has been known to manifest his will within idols dedicated to his honor.
This vile creature has been summoned from Elsewhere drawn by the lyrical song of the Chanter.
This twisted monstrosity is sacrificing anything that lives to the True Gods, thus increasing their hold over Stillwater.

A bestial servant of the Old Ones haunts both the land and sea devouring all who stand against the eternal True Gods. They throw themselves heedlessly into battle with no thought of themselves. Their only wish is to serve their vile masters.

These restless spirits haunts the broken wreckage of their ship and murder any stranger they find. Although their movements are uncharacteristically sluggish as if they are fighting some form of compulsion.

The Shredder is a result of prolonged feasting on nothing but chaotic thoughts drenched in terror. It is little wonder that it manifests into such a abhorrent and vicious creature, as it is all the creature has ever known.

This formless shifting thing lurks in the shadowy places just out of sight. It silently haunts it's prey, but the attentive will sense it for the wrongness that envelopes this loathsome aberration of nature.

Across in infinite darkness the Fate Drinker saw the threads of possibility that were stitched within the existence of the living. It hungered to feast on those unseen futures and make them it's own. Anyone who gazes into it's unblinking eyes will see their future unraveled before them and vanish into the blazing fires of the Drinker.

The Chill Forest Polarweres are native to this cold land. They are foul-tempered beasts that are part-man but their reason and mind have been consumed by the spirit of the polar bear. The Polarwere Alphas are even more fearsome than their lesser kin, easily outfighting the local Trolls and making a messy meal of them.
Carpabeasts are savage killers that are generally servants of the Shadow Lord whom they worship as a god.

The Rawnethian Royal Guard protect the queen and they will gladly die doing so. These warriors are powerful and armed with deadly spears and covered in and exoskeleton stronger than any knights plate armor.

Raptors are dangerous creatures from ancient times. Raptors have thrived extinction by remaining hidden deep in the Rawneth Woods. Few ever survive an attack by a pack of Raptors, for together they form a well coordinated stealthy killing machine. The pack Matriarch will direct the pack to greater killing efficiency, though they are as brutal to their pack as their prey.

Bugbears are large brutish Greenskins that are covered in greasy hair. These barbaric beasts have recently entered the forest wreaking havoc and breaking everything they come across. It is thought they have been drawn here after overhearing tales of wealth and abundant travellers to feed on.

Many of the Zinsaur Hatchlings grow into these Reptilian warriors. Armed with a spear and wooden shield, the Zinsaur Warrior roams the Quindaneth Coast, protecting hatchlings from harm. The Zinsaur Warrior is a skilled fighter but is also capable of attacking using its deadly claws and teeth when needed.

This breed of Incendia Treeman is native to the Quindaneth Woods and they will fight to protect their home. The Incendia Treemen take after the trees of the forest and have the same forever red foliage, helping them blend in to forest with ease.

The Quindaneth Doomsaur are the undead remains of the predators that once lived in Quindaneth. The Doomsaurs still crave for the flesh of the living although they may never be able to taste it ever again.

The Quindaneth Wastes are home to tribes of reptilian Dinosauroids. They are much more intelligent than your average giant reptile that is normally encountered in the area but still have the predatory instincts needed to be efficient predators.
This malignant Demon seeps through the cracks of the mine and kill anything they find. The Dwarves have long since given up on digging here because of the danger.

The Tylock Honga are ghost like earth spirits. Peaceful creatures generally, the only thing the Honga hate is those who despoil the earth and steal its minerals and dig it away. This wrecks the Hongas perfect view of the ground they drift through like a sea. The Honga distrust miners and surface people.

The Warsmith has an honoured place in the Syroth Clan, he crafts the fine battle machines from the unique ore found only in the Mines. The metal forged from this ore multiplies spells imbued into them. Making the Dwarfen Runes of power even more potent!

A foul creature that dwells in the blackest areas of the abandoned castle. None know where the Screaming Spawn comes from and none really want to find out. This misshapen beast screams a noise so awful it would make even a hardened Dwarf think twice about confronting one.

Dusk Goblin Riders ride huge Cave lizards that have naturally sharp claws which grip the rock floor of the underground Passages. The lizards have a poisonous saliva that paralyses it's victims, leaving the Dusk Goblin Rider with an easy prey.

A small tribe of Orcs dwell in the area, killing or robbing any who pass through Pyron. Although they live deep in this desolate area, their skill at looting travellers means their warrior brutes are well armed for combat with stolen war gear. The Deadaxe Orcs are an elite group of the tribe, armed with the best weapons!

Stoneback Beetles roam the rocky outcrops. These giant boulder sized insects are just as strong as the rocks they resemble. A fight against a Stoneback is said to be like fighting a boulder too, only one that can crush you at will!
The Sand Djinn are magical creatures of animated sand. They have magic power over sand and can morph it into weapons to kill. Sand Djinn are often blamed for creating droughts and bad sand storms.

The so-called Wernoth Bandit Knights are dangerous foes to come up against as they are experts in lightning fast ambush attacks upon unsuspecting travellers in the desert. The Knights are known for cruel treatment of defeated foes, leaving any survivors tied up and left for the Giant Cockroaches or the elements to take.

The Knights of Indormar are well known around the world as great mercenaries. The knights are secretive about their origins but it is assumed they hail from a secret keep, hidden away in the desert. The Knights have come home to defend the city.

Hyrom Capcauns are huge brutish creatures that dwell in caves in the area. The Hyrom Capcaun are ogre sized beings with snarling dog like faces that carry clubs which they squash their prey with. The Hyrom Capcaun are addicted to eating humans and if the scent of man is in the air they will travel long distances to find and devour the unfortunate person.

Hyrom Glacial Giants wander the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest local legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.
These highly skilled warriors were part of the forgotten Gelorath empire. These particular warriors were slain during a major battle hundreds of years ago.

The Gelorath Troglodites are frightful Greenskins that prowl the cold caves. They are lone hunters and man eaters who are said to delight in slowly skinning their victims alive before eating them. They are adorned with the bones and skins of their prey.

The Necral were an ancient tribe that lived in the mountains, dabbling in dark magic and worshipped evil gods but have since died out. Often in the caves, the Necrals greatest warriors known as the Haunters will rise as a result of their dark magic rituals. These warriors were buried in the finest of bronze armour and  with the best of weapons and are a dangerous foe to behold.

The Teminar Deinotherium is a huge Elephant like beast that roam these lands. Few would dare confront such a powerful and dangerous beast though packs of Teminar Bastet Lions often try to make a Deinotherium lunch, many being crushed to death by the beasts raw power as they try.

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant, out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their foe.
The foul greenskins known as Teminar Grofflesnouts wander these lands preying on lost travellers and sometimes banding together in small groups to raid small settlements.
These massive brutes are native to the Teminar Grasslands. The Teminar Ogres are a savage lot, wearing furs and trinkets taken from their defeated enemies.

The strength and tenacity of the Alkaar Kingdom has always been symbolized by the Sphinx. This powerful magical creature should be feared as it is said it's very gaze can freeze even the most skilled Warrior in their tracks.
This blood crazed Outcast feasts on his victims flesh to empower him to defeat his enemies. As the bodycount rises so does the brutality of this vicious bandit.
Some of the stronger Owlbear males stalk silently through the dark shadows of the Sathrin Forest for anyone who may be hunting their kindred.
This dark spirit moves with an almost hypnotic serpentine grace. This is the only attractive aspect of the malevolent demon, as seeks only to bring pain and misery to the living for it's master.
This aberration of nature serves just one purpose. Driven by an all consuming  madness, the Malfaisant now spreads the very corrosive evil that has remade them into a thing of vile darkness.
Cursed in life, death is no release for this tormented soul. Now he serves two masters, a hunger it cannot sate and the cruel Dark Mage who bound him to this evil fate.
Every city has it's Assassins Guild and this City is no different. They are a quick and quiet way to get your own back. At a price of course.

One of Xinderoth's greatest weaknesses is his arrogance. The eye was his chosen symbol and he celebrates it in this creation. It is not known if Xinderoth can view what the Eye sees. It is without doubt, that The Eye is purely an object of vanity.
Some of the Goblin Quickblades are more cruel and devious than others. One must always be on your guard with dealing with Goblins, or you will soon find yourself with a lighter coin purse or worse.
The Daggertooth males protect their female Prowlers to the death. The coat of a Pridemane is treasured by the local tribes as it is said that the Pridemane's claws can rip through almost any armor.

Denarath Dryad Warwitch is a much more powerful type of Denarath Dryad. Unlike their sisters, they are rarer though they make up for this with a staggering grasp of natural woodland magic and an incandescent rage which dwarfs even their sisters anger over the damage done to the local woods.

The Spearmen of the Denarath tribe are numerous and well trained for Orcs. In times of war great units of of these disciplined warriors march over the battlefield destroying all in their path led by their unit champions who keep order by bellowing commands and issuing the odd punch to their Spearmen if they fall out of line.

Herds of Razox roam the tundra of the Denarath Mountains. Razox Bulls are huge creatures and are very protective of the herd. A charge from a Razox Bull is generally fatal as they crush their enemies with pure strength or cut them to shreds on their razor sharp horns.

The rare Black Denarath Bears roam the tundra looking for food. They are carnivorous and can easily chase down prey and overpower them with their great bulk, often dragging their prey long distances back to their dens to be devoured. The Black Denarath Bear are seen as sacred to the clans of the area who admire the strength and power of these beasts.

Lash Skolex are giant horrible worms that gorge themselves on the bones and corpses of creatures killed in the pass by Rubble hunters. The Lash Skolex is not adverse to hunting for itself when opportunity arises, using its long venomous tongue to stun and drag its prey towards its grotesque fanged maw to be eaten.

Tayarog Radande are magical beings bound to the tree they were born to for the rest of the trees life. The Tayarog Radande are bound to trees corrupted by dark magics and other evil forces in the forests and have become evil beings capable of great harm to others as a result.

The Willow Nymphs are beautiful female creatures with skin that looks like a tree bark and have trailing leaves for hair. They are known to bewitch travellers to their doom with magic and other fey enchantments.
Once part of the the Town Guard, now this honorable soldier has become one of the very horrors he's spent his entire life protecting Raloheim from.

Some of the Workmen had more promise than others when Professor Morbidstein opened up their skulls. The more competent he worked on for longer and so these unfortunates are even stronger than their co-workers. Best be on the look out for them, they are hard to distinguish among the other zombie workforce.
These massively strong primates swing within the canopy of Falden forest. They are fiercely territorial and will not think twice about attacking anybody encroaching upon their treetop territory.
The Depths Crocs are demons that swim within the lava flows in the Khairn Depths. Created by fire and brimstone this entity delights in mindless destruction.

The Enrage Shadow is a sickening form which stalk the plain. These Demons have only one feature that can be picked out from their black form, a screaming mouth that howls curses and words that somehow strike fear into all that hear them despite coming from some unknown demonic language.
Well known for their skill with finely crafted swords in the gladiator arenas, these Blademasters can be found throughout the city of Thracan.
These undead creatures have been driven to the living world by a thirst of blood and flesh.

The Vomit Crab has evolved to live in the wettest areas of the jungle. The crab ensnares its victims by vomiting a crippling venom on its prey. It's armored carapace is capable of shrugging off most attacks from the few predators it has. The Vomit Crab is also capable of burrowing beneath the ground to ambush potential prey.

The Krillis Tribe are a mysterious cloaked desert people, said to practice mysterious magic deep in the desert and commune with their gods. They protect their lands well against intruders and their Mage Archers kill their foes from afar with enchanted magical arrows that hit with unnatural accuracy.

Ashspawn are foul Demons that were born from a nearby volcano. It is said that the ashes interrupted the evil rituals of a cursed King of the Coast and from the ashes grew the horrific Ashspawn that still roam these forests.
These feral vermin creatures travel through the sewer depths, hunting down food, even if its the odd occasional companion.
These talented fire breathers are dedicated to entertaining the masses. They do like a good tip though, so make sure you have some spare coin or things may get a little hot for you.

The Legionnaire is a finely trained footsoldier. They follow orders to the letter, and take great pride in the garrisons victorious history. No Legionnaire wants to stain that history with failure, making these warriors both determined and tenacious.

Tharhe Paleskin Hunter are a vicious tribe of Goblins that infest this Realm. Unlike other feral Goblin tribes they do not use any type of poison to take down their prey. Instead they immobilise them with bolas then finish off their kill using long curved black knives.
A large clan of Ogres that lived within the forest have caught kind of malady, which leaves its victims in a zombie-like state. They are extremely dangerous!

These Orcs have built several small villages along this area. The Mullseer Savages use poison from local plants to coat their weapons and bodies when they go into battle as it makes them more dangerous. The Orcs love the danger of these forests but when there is a lack of dangerous beasts around to fight they often go and wage war against a neighboring clans village for fun.
The Clan Arathir are savage automotons from the cold lands of Thrass. The Clans Juggernauts are titanic constructs of great power and have been sent to the valleys destroy any intruders.

The Kantariss Dol Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Barrow Lands long before the bastion was built. Some legends speak that these vile creatures used their dark magic to enslave the men at Kantariss Dol to their will.
Imbued with powerful magic, these massive armoured forms defend the corridors of the Bastion, killing any foes which dare to enter.

Unholy Shades are said to be the ghosts of   the most evil of dark magic users, blasphemers and worshippers of the dark gods. These spirits have been banished here upon their deaths and scream curses of revenge against the living and of those who passed on towards their chosen afterlife while they are trapped in this frozen realm.

Kanfall Soldiers are the backbone of the Kanfall tribe. These creatures are well skilled with their weapons and tunnel fighting tactics but are said to fair badly when fighting in the open or on the surface.

The Dark Alfadl are a race of evil Elves from a neighbouring region who regularly patrol this area. The Dark Alfadl Nightmares are mounted warriors that ride atop well built steeds whos hides are as black as their riders souls. These well armed warriors patrol the rugged terrain of the forest.

The Phaerl Hell Bound are elite warriors. These hand picked warriors all wear the heaviest armor. It seems to be able to guide the wearer away from harm and can in short periods of time heal itself. Some doubt whether the Dwarfs who wear it are even in control of themselves now...

Many of the Closine were drowned in boiling tar that flowed up through the ground or from a nearby Asphalt Volcano. These unfortunates still dwell in the area today, misshapen and covered in glooping tar they area and even more terrifying sight than their other unfortunate clansmen.

Swampmen are almost humanoid beings that shamble through the swamp. Resembling nothing much more than a large mass of rotting swamp plants and mud they are well camouflaged and can sneak up on prey with ease, or for the truly unfortunate they might even be the very ground they are standing upon!
This highly skilled archer inhabits the Zuul Forest, living within the tree tops. They launch aerial on unsuspecting victims below the treetops.
This frozen skeletal warrior is a deadly adversary. Few are known to have survived encounters by this ferocious warrior.
The Elihir are elders of their tribe, trained in the arts of magic.
No longer recognisable as an Elvish warrior, these contorted undead creatures unleash their terrible fury against those attempting to advance through these Elvish lands.
The Barkhide Elemental is a thornvine Elemental grown to have an immensely strong, natural armor formed from the bark of the most ancient and formidable trees still alive in the Zuul Forest.

Jadhara Dust Devils appear without warning near its victims before tearing them apart. Local scavenger tales say these winds are more than just natural phenomena and that an evil lies within the eye of the Arid Dust Devil. Often some say this is just a naturally strong wind. Others say a more powerful intelligence lies within.
In contrast to their golden cousins, these Satyr have learned to tolerate other species within its habitat. However, these Satyr will protect their territory should they feel threatened in any way.

These beasts were imported from a distant unknown tropical land by shadowy traders. The creatures have come to be known as Hell Rippers for they have a nasty demeanour and the magical fires burning from their manes. The rare Blue flamed Hell Rippers are more powerful.

This deadly worm is a large eyeless invertebrate that use sense to find prey that have made their homes in the pathways. In addition to using the labyrinth pathways the Worms have dug out many of their own burrows in the area creating shortcuts in the maze layout but also deadly pathways to nowhere but death in the jaws of these beasts.

These mysterious people often take on the appearances of fungus or lichens in order to hide in the forest. Watchers look out for dangers that might enter their realm, then warn the others to hide. They also use magic against foes they believe aren't too dangerous and more easy to repel by themselves.
These poisonous snakes are temperamental and will bite anyone that is not of their own kind.

These beasts are large man like creatures made from coral. These Creatures lie dormant upon the reef almost invisible to the human eye due to their natural camouflage but spring to life when potential prey comes close, savaging their   victims in their rock hard jaws.
These deadly warriors are the husks of anceint warriors that served in the Ice Kings army during his rule. Now that the Ice King has departed, these creatures are left to roam the area.
The Thief cares little for his life beyond his aspiration to attain the grandest of jewels.
This creature roams the sandy crawlways, hunting down potential victims courageous enough so enter the labyrinth.
This small and rather cute looking furball is peaceful looking until it opens its jaws, presenting an array of razor sharp teeth capable of rending flesh in an instant.

These Ogres are huge beasts that wander the arid flats in search of food and water. They differ from other Ogres due to unique physiology and evolutionary adaptions caused by living in the desert area that allow the Ogre to survive longer than most creatures in such an inhospitable environment.

These Orcs are part of a local tribe and rumoured man eaters. Armed with a primitive but deadly spear and shield, these Orc's will defend their territory fiercely and carry away any intruders they catch, dragging them screaming into the deepest area of the swamp.

These Orcs are part of a local tribe and rumoured man eaters. Armed with a primitive but deadly spear and shield, these Orc's will defend their territory fiercely and carry away any intruders they catch, dragging them screaming into the deepest area of the swamp.
This Wraith floats across the Ethereal landscape in search for souls to press gang into it's service.
This Wraith floats across the Ethereal landscape in search for souls to press gang into it's service.

These large carnivorous Orchid like plants are able to move slowly around looking for prey. These exotic plants have a Blue flower and can spit an acid some distance at its prey. The acid is so strong it can melt the victim into a soup in seconds.

A guardian of the Weaver strides across the Reef constantly searching for anything that can sate it's eternal hunger. A powerful magical controlling spell has been cast over these brutes by a pirate king in the area.
This mysterious dark entity drifts across the Ethereal Plains, searching for lifeforms to drain the life force from. Few survive an encounter with this deadly creature.

The Giant Ground Sloth is normally a gentle giant however it scares easily and becomes a highly aggressive smashing machine with razor sharp claws. Very few who upset a Giant Ground Sloth come away in one piece...

The Whispercorn is a very rare type of Unicorn. They appear as other unicorns do except they are of a purple hue and their horn is silver and seems to radiate with magic. Highly private and intelligent creatures, to disturb them in their magical grottos is to bring their wrath upon you.

The Ention Abac is a large, multi eyed beast from the deep that is covered in purple scales and spines. These monsters are known for their venomous bites and their long constricting tongues that they use to drag prey from the shore into their gaping maws. A magical controlling spell has been cast over these creatures by a powerful pirate king.
The Sernath Drow Training Masters are in the process of re-educated their errant people in the art of war.They relish an extra challenge then.

The Sernath Dol Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Pass of the Fallen long before the bastion was built. The most powerful of the Wights are the Sernath Dol Ice Wights, beings that are said to be able to freeze a man's blood with but a single look from their evil cold eyes, before cutting him dawn with their icy blades.

The Frost Hippogryph is a strange mix of eagle and horse. These creatures normally only hunt in the highest peaks of the mountains but recently Frost Hippogryphs have been hunting in lower altitudes, preying on the flocks of Snow Sheep. It is known that fact that Frost Hippogryph stallion can be very aggressive if encountered.

These giant snake-like creatures slither through the Bosjnir Depths, only occasionally ascending to the surface to hunt for food. These beasts are deadly efficient when hunting in their own environment and have the ability to turn enemy's to stone if they wish although this is rare behaviour as the Depths Basilisk often needs fresh food.

This area is protected by Bone Golems, beings that are magically constructed by the monks to serve them. The Bone Golems feel no fear nor pain and are utterly relentless in battle against those foolish enough to trespass in the temple.
This creature blends in perfectly to its surroundings thanks to its camouflaged skin. A tough shell protects its body from attacks and is camouflaged perfectly to blend into its natural habitat.
These dwellers consist of several tribes of mysterious shadowy people. Little is known about the dwellers except that they are expert hunters and that few survive a face to face encounter with them.

The Kediya Beetle is a massive sand coloured Insect. They roam the arid desert searching for smaller grubs to feast upon. It has been known for these creatures to attack larger prey, especially if they feel their young is under threat.

The wings of the Fae are delicate, and there are times when the wings receive so much damage that they have to be removed from the creature. This is a terrible fate for magical beings that gain their self worth from their magical roots. They are taught to direct this rage and pain into the fire element from which their desire forms new wings of the very flame they channel. The irony is that these Fae seem far more impressive to the untrained eye than their whole bodied brethren though they are prone to terrible bouts of rage.

Strange and wild, these creatures are said to have no dealings with others in the forest and fearlessly protect their groves, but some tales say they do on occasion help travellers in trouble from Bandits or the trickery of Brownies.
This demonic creature has been resurrected from the volcanic ashes, and now carries out the wishes of its master, Alikir the Dark.
The Fire Sprites are natural denizens of these ferociously hot environs. They are aggressive, as suits such a creature of flame. They attack on sight and without mercy!
The Chari tribe Slavers are foul beasts that manage the slaves captured by the Tribe.

Gargoyles are grotesque and evil creatures made of living stone. They have infested the Crystal Fields in great numbers. Gargoyles attack any entering the fields with deadly Piercing Strikes with their rock hard claws and talons, seemingly  protecting the path that leads deeper into the field...

The Proll Treemen are twisted and evil beings. These ancient creatures slowly wander the forest killing and crushing all they see as a threat to the forest and its inhabitants with mighty fists of gnarled wood.

Grass Deathworms are common in this area. These worms are almost blind and slither through the long grasses sensing for prey with sensitive hairs that cover their bodies. These senses more than make up for their poor sight and they can easily locate prey over vast distances.

Rektik Soldiers are backbone of the Rektikians army. These creatures are well skilled with their weapons and tunnel fighting tactics but are said to fair badly when fighting in the open or on the surface.

The Fiender is a demonic beast that has only recently been spotted in the forest. The Fienders are creatures of filth and poison and they gnaw the trees causing them to wilt and die. These Demons are said to have been sent by and evil force to cause destruction although who or what sent them remains a mystery even to the inhabitants of the forest.

The Dornath Yaoguai are demon minions of the God GorGulGol. They are his demonic scouts and have been observed searching the forest. Although it is unknown what it is they are looking for, the presence of these servants of GorGulGol is not to be taken lightly as the Dornath Yaoguai are only ever sent on the most important of missions.

The Soktharg live in small villages around the base of their Voresshh Temple. These are protected by Warriors of immense skill. The Warriors do not just rely on skill alone to defeat opponents as they are armed with evil runic weapons gifted to them by their chief Shaman Hhrrrss.

Polarweres are native to this cold land, foul tempered beasts that are as much man as they are ice bear. The Polarwere can easily tear a man limb from limb and are feared even by the giants in the area.
According to local legends the jackal-headed beings known as the Anubis are associated with the afterlife.
These Vespid are a sentient race of creatures that reside deep within the slopes. Its fiercely territorial and will attack those who foolishly wonder in.

The Winged Arachnid is a creature created by twisted magics, creating what is basically a giant flying spider. These creatures are only capable of short periods of flight and are not able to create a web like average spiders thus rely on surprise aerial assaults on their prey which they then devour as they catch them.

These Knights are dangerous foes to come up against as they are experts in lightning fast ambush attacks upon unsuspecting travellers in the desert. The Knights are known for cruel treatment of defeated foes.

These unscrupulous individuals go to any length to ensure the Lord Protectors targets are dispatched in any manner possible. They also wander around the town haranguing the citizens and brow beating any who show any sign of disagreeing with them.

The Gray Hags are a sisterhood of ugly and monstrous witches that live deep in the Tellroth Depths. Here in the ruins, the Gray Hags perform the dark arts, cavort with Demons and raise the dead, all the while casting curses upon mankind.

Deathsabres are powerful undead warriors in ancient rusting armor. They have a sorcerous power that allows it to infuse it's weapons with the same necromantic energies that sustain them. The effect of these energies on living beings is....unpleasant.

The Necral were an ancient tribe that lived in the Caverns, dabbling in dark magic and worshipped evil gods. Their gods cared little for them and eventually this evil tribe died out, leaving little but their frozen corpses buried in the dark. However, saturated in dark magic these corpses have a habit of returning from the dead, carrying their ancient bronze weapons and seeking out the living.

These necromantic horrors appear to have risen with the destruction of the Dark Queen. The deathblow released pent up necromantic energies throughout the caves, strengthening those already risen while granting fell unlife to any nearby corpses, regardless of their condition.

Subterranean Deathworms plague caverns all over the Realms. In fact some believe that many of the tunnels and even the caverns themselves were created by these vile worms. The Deathworms have corrosive saliva that aids them in chewing through the rock as they burrow and also as a weapon when finding prey.

Even the cows are not immune to this plague of undeath! The Tywith Zombie Dairy Cow is roaming the pastures, grazing on any living creatures they can catch. They also make do with the corpses of creatures that have died the true death. They are creating a nasty, poisonous smelling fluid in their udders now, which the Milkmaids gather in a parody of their former lives.

The Bonegwar are fur covered bestial giants that live in the Dresnoth plains.Smashers come from the low plains with other Bonegwar where they use their big clubs to break down the homes and defences of villages so they can get at their favourite food more easily.
From the Dreg tar pit the Tarnitch crawls in to the halflight of the Swamp, it devours anything that crosses it's path to fuel the fires within.

Poison Swamp Worms lay in wait just below the swampy ground. When they sense prey they spring out and bite down upon their prey, injecting them with a huge amount of toxin that more often than not, will kill instantly.

This strange beast lurks in the shallow waters of the Phosveroth Swamp. It pulls it's victims down into the cold waters then devours them. It is best not to use swords against this creature as it's blood is a powerful acid that can melt almost any metal. Hunters carry long spears to pin the Acid Beast to the swamp floor and simply move on. Other Phosveroth denizens  see these trapped  Acid Beasts as an easy meal...
Katannisdiles are thin Crocodile-like reptiles that live in the swamps. They hunt at the water's edge looking for prey to drag into the water. They are well armoured with scales and spiky horns.
The Aquiasaur is expertly suited to life in the darkness of the forests and takes advantage of this with its superior night sight and natural camouflage.

The Xaintor Tiger is an apex predator, it is at the top of the food chain and fears nothing. You won't know they are stalking you till it's too late. They go for the throat, dig their dagger like teeth and claws deep into the flesh of their prey and won't let go till it's dead.

The Grove Hopper is an aggressive marsupial native to these jungles. The Grove Hopper uses its large leg muscles to bound effortlessly through the undergrowth in pursuit of prey, which it then catches in its razor sharp claws and tears apart to eat.

Xaintor Vipers are highly venomous snakes that have dwelt in the jungle for longer than anyone know. Everyone agrees that to disrespect the Vipers means death. Needless to say, no one told the Orcs this......

The Great Ganaroth Ibex is native to the Ganaroth Canyons. It is a large angry beast with long horns and strong skull which it uses to head butt its enemies and other Great Ganaroth Ibex during the mating season. The Great Ganaroth Ibex has learned to fear the Capcauns due to the amount of hunting that happens upon the canyons but is ever the two should meet the Ibex will not hesitate in attacking if it cannot escape first.

The Sand Djinn are magical creatures of animated sand. They have magic power over sand and can morph it into weapons to kill. Sand Djinn are often blamed by local people for creating droughts and bad sand storms.
The townsfolk of Anarain gather in the common square for their market. In amongst the shoppers, you'll have to be wary for any cutpurses!

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant, out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their foe.

The Elephus Bahamut is a giant species of man-eating fish that has a long trunk atop its fanged mouth. These strange-looking creatures are covered in horny scales that are stronger than steel and are said to make fine armor for those who can get them. They use their trunk to grasp prey from the shore or boats and once caught in their grasp there is no chance of escape.

Mermaids are seductive half fish half women that use unearthly powers to attract people to them. Once entranced the Mermaid will drag their helpless victim into the depths of the sea, drowning them and then eating them.

The Chodrmen are a race of Shark people that live deep under the sea, often coming to the islands to hunt or battle with Corallians. The Saw Chodrman are among the strongest and most deadly of their kind. Naturally armed with a huge saw-like nose, they can wield it with terrifying skill in battle slashing at foes within reach. Any not caught by the ripping teeth of the saw will be attacked by the twin tooth blades the Chodrman also carries.

Murk Trolls live in the dirtiest areas of Lokat and those who know this stay as far away from such places as possible. The Murk Troll is a well muscled greenskin, but thankfully has little intelligence in its ugly head other than the need to hit things and tear them apart with it's bare hands and devouring what remains of it's victim.

The Giant Sea Snake does not live exclusively in the sea, but is most at home there hunting large fish, dolphins and other large monsters of the deep. When not at sea they live in coral caves along the coasts side. The venom of these serpents is not that powerful but when you're as large as a Giant Sea Snake it doesn't have to be.

The Pellranor Giant Termites have been magically enlarged. Who would do this and why is unknown. The beast have been moving through the surrounding woods, destroying all the trees as they go. This has had a serious knock on effect to the local ecology. All the Termites know is there is lots of wood to chew through.

Judging from the fine armour and sword this undead was probably a elite swordsman in life. But whatever he was in the past, he now eternally drags his greatsword mindlessly through the Kethnoir trees.

Thaengol Fairies are generally mischievous but they do have a darker side as many of the Fae do. There are many tales of the Daco Fairies using magical glamour to confuse travellers and send them in the wrong direction. Other tales tell of the darker side to these Fae where they steal children away from their parents and are never seen again...

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest where they hunt prey. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. Red Hypeezles are the most prolific of the Hypeezle species in the forest and often hunt in small family packs. They are noted for having a chilling call that sounds like an evil laugh.
Juggernauts are titanic men of great power and have been sent to the woods from the coast to police the area and destroy any intruders.
These Dryads are very protective of their land and intruders are viewed with extreme suspicion and are eliminated if given even the slightest reason.

Strange beings of blue live in the very ice itself. Some local legends describe them as the magical embodiment and living will of the ice or even the Flats itself. Whatever the truth these beings have power over the very snow and ice itself. The most powerful of the Snow Callers can call upon lumps of ice and rock to hurl at foes or even blizzards of razor sharp icicles that shred and freeze.

Wizards enchanted pools of lit oil in the Catacomb with magical life. These Living Fires still burn today, moving with a life of their own and attacking and smothering any who enter their vicinity with a gruesome fiery death. Some of these Fires seem to burn brighter with enchantments than others, changing the colours of flame and increasing their power tenfold.
These rats can grow up to the size of a bull and are very dangerous creatures. They feed on the men that have been sent down to kill them.

The Snorgs are beastmen from far away mountains that have banded together in whats known as a Snorgherd to take the city of Peridon. The job of the Snorg Wreckers within the herd is to terrify the citizens into submission with violence and acts of property destruction. The leaders of these groups of Snorgs wield large stone Maces to further their efforts in destruction.

Plains Trolls are large gangly beasts, unlike much like any other Troll type that tend to look well fed. These Trolls are more cunning and bold in their actions as it lives in a land where food is scarce and there is little terrain for the Troll to hide in ambush so it must make bold open attacks on its prey.

Few have survived encounters with the near mythical Fire Golems. Legends state that the black steel cage like effigies that contain the roaring fire of the Golem within were created by Mages deep under a fiery mountain and thus it is they whom these beings will serve until they are extinguished.

The caves here once were home to the now extinct Wyza. These Giant Cobra-like serpents were hunted into oblivion by the Galraq as sacrifices to their great god Zaq. Now only the angry spirits of the Wyza exist.

The Galraquian Royal Guard protect the queen and they will gladly die doing so. These warriors are powerful and armed with deadly spears and covered in and exoskeleton stronger than any knights plate armor. The Champions of the Guard are the only ones with direct contact with the queen and are often seen as being the personal bodyguards to the queen.
Ratman Vanguard Leaders are in command of the Ratman Vanguard. They seem brighter that most Ratmen but still incapable of this level of battle smarts!
The boiling battle rage of the Swordsmaster fuels his strength and endurance in combat. One should think twice before meeting this man in single combat.

The rampaging Grofflesnout in the region are being lead by monstrous brutes. These thuggish monsters rules through raw aggression and will happily tear into anything or any one who stands in their way!

The Deinotherium is a huge Elephant like beast that roam these lands. Few would dare confront such a powerful and dangerous beast though packs of Multuubo Cheetahs often try and fail to make a Deinotherium lunch, many being crushed to death by the beasts raw power as they try.

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their enemies. The largest of the Honbucks normally lead the herd and are more likely to confront a foe.

The plains are often swept with hot volcanic ash storms. It is within these storms that the feared Mares of Doom charge from. These horse like creatures made from the very ash of the storm and the stronger the storm the more powerful the Doom Mare within it. The strongest of these storms are said to be able to cook a man alive in his armor or seer his flesh from his very bones!

Few have survived encounters with the near mythical Fire Golems. Legends state that the black steel cage like effigies that contain the roaring fire of the Golem within were created by Mages deep under a fiery mountain and thus it is they whom these beings will serve until they are extinguished.

Valali Dwarf Chargers are the foot soldiers of the Valali Dwarves. These Dwarves are armed with huge reinforced shields that they use to bash into their enemies with bone cracking force, and that's even before they attack with their battle axes.

Deep in these dark forests live Black Deer, not unlike the Deer of other lands except their hide is as black as pitch. The Kingstags rule over the herds of Black Deer in the forest and viciously protect them. These huge Deer are larger and more deadly than any of their kin and a charge from their antlers is bound to prove fatal.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest where they hunt prey. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. Red Hypeezles are the most prolific of the Hypeezle species in the forest and often hunt in small family packs. They are noted for having a chilling call that sounds like an evil laugh.

Of all the trees in the forest, none are as foul and evil as the Wailing Tupelo. These trees are hard to tell apart from normal trees in the swampy forests except for the evil faces wrought into the bark of the tree. The older Wailing Tupelo emits such powerful screams from its faces when someone in near,it can cause the explosion of its victim, leaving little more than a bloody stain in the swamp.

When a Black Knife fills his dark knife with notches they can make challenge for leadership. This is done before the entire clan of Black Knives. The victor leaves the fight with his heart still in his chest and their opponents Black knife as a trophy.

Plains Trolls are large gangly beasts, unlike much like any other Troll type that tend to look well fed. These Trolls are more cunning and bold in their actions as it lives in a land where food is scarce and there is little terrain for the Troll to hide in ambush so it must make bold open attacks on its prey. The fastest of their kind are the most successful hunters and leaders of their small tribes.

Herds of Razox roam the tundra of the Nalrath Mountains. Razox Bulls are huge creatures and are very protective of the herd. A charge from a Razox Bull is generally fatal as they crush their enemies with pure strength or cut them to shreds on their razor sharp horns.

Glacial Giants wander the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.

The Monagoth Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Pass. Some legends speak that these vile creatures used their dark magic to enslave the men in the region to their will. Ice Wights, beings that are said to be able to freeze a man's blood with but a single look from their evil cold eyes, before cutting him dawn with their icy blades.
The Greater Magmasaur is, as you'd expect, an even larger version of the normal beast. It will attack and devour anything it comes across, even lesser Magmasaurs!

The corrupted Daranoth priesthood have created some form of Cathedral in the depths this fortress. Daranoth Deacons the first true step of ascension within their Priesthood. Their skin is jet black and their hair is purest white. They are skilled with their glaives in combat.

The Fiender is a demonic beast that has only recently been spotted in the forest. The Fiender's are creatures of filth and poison and they gnaw the trees causing them to wilt and die. These Demons are said to have been sent by and evil force to cause destruction although who or what sent them remains a mystery even to the inhabitants of the forest.

Raptors are dangerous creatures from ancient times. Raptors have thrived extinction by remaining hidden deep in the Mandaron Forest. Few ever survive an attack by a pack of Raptors, for together they form a well coordinated stealthy killing machine.

The Garnath Termite Kings are even larger and are far more voracious than their lesser brethren. Their wicked mandibles have the power to slice through the largest of trees (and doughiest of Warriors) in a single bite.

Murk Trolls live in the dirtiest areas of Vantiock and those who know this stay as far away from such places as possible. The Murk Troll is a well muscled greenskin, but thankfully has little intelligence in its ugly head other than the need to hit things and tear them apart with its bare hands and devouring what remains of its victim.

Ancient tales have said the the Black Hart is a omen of change for whoever sees it. If it is slain, the reasons for the hunter killing the Black Hart colours the omen. A Hunter who kills the Black Hart out of desperation will be blessed with good fortune. Should the Black Hart be slain out of greed, the Hunter will be cursed until the price for the spilt blood is paid.

These formless vampires appear as only a blur in a roughly human shape. The only features that can be picked out are their blood red eyes and a fanged mouth. These ghostly creatures prey upon the living. The more they feed the more corporal their form becomes, growing bones and organs and eventually skin and transforming into an even more powerful creature once fully flesh.
