A cunning Bonepicker with no thought other than making Throttla number one in the Balacath. She has a formidable appetite for dealing pain and food and has great ambition for a Goblin, with her cunning mind constantly thinking on ways to make her tribe rich and powerful. Few dare to cross her.

The Deinotherium is a huge Elephant like beast that roam these lands. Few would dare confront such a powerful and dangerous beast though packs of Chimeras often try and fail to make a Deinotherium lunch, many being crushed to death by the beasts raw power as they try.
These massive brutes are native to the Tenarite Grasslands. The Tenarite Ogres are a savage lot, wearing furs and trinkets taken from their defeated enemies.

The oldest and most evil Sibisu are known as the Aged. These beings appear to be made from cracked and burnt sand. Tales tell of how these beings are indestructible for once destroyed and their sandy bodies are scattered to the winds they will slowly reform again in another location.

The King Chodrman are the leaders and finest warriors of their people. Only the strong and brutal may lead the Chodrman people and must prove themselves regularly by leading war parties from the city and bringing back tales of victory. The Corallian people are often victims of the king and his battle lust but it is only a matter of time before the king and their war hosts destroy the Corallians for good and move on to terrorize others...

The reef supports a huge amount of sea life that live deep in caves within the coral. The Ridged Gymnothorax is one of the most dangerous of these animals and has a venomous bite. These Giant Eels often hunt close to the surface looking for prey. Thankfully these poisonous terrors are quite rare.

One of many tribes in the area, The Birannith Orcs are very territorial and will slay anybody who enters their lands. The leaders of the Birannith Orcs are brutal warriors that care little for personal safety as they rush their enemies with their wicked weapons.
Those who survive an attack of the Killer Penguin can also fall to this cruel curse. Where they themselves turn into the very monster they sought to defeat.

The Cold Rusalki are malicious beings linked magically to the frozen ice that makes up their glacier homes. The Cold Rusalki despise anyone who would dare enter their domain uninvited and delight in freezing their enemies with icy blasts or impaling them upon icicles that erupt from their domains. Some Cold Rusalki are said to be powerful they can freeze the air around them or even their foes blood.

Glacial Giants wonder the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest Yeti legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.

Deep in these dark forests live Black Deer, not unlike the Deer of other lands except their hide is as black as pitch. The Kingstags rule over the herds of Black Deer in the forest and viciously protect them. These huge Deer are larger and more deadly than any of their kin and a charge from their antlers is bound to prove fatal.
Greater Black Jaguar is a powerful but thankfully rare relation to the Greater Jaguar. It is considered a delicacy to the local goblin tribes due to its rich tasting meat.

Arid Dust Devils appear without warning near its victims before tearing them apart. Local scavenger tales say these winds are more than just natural phenomena and that an evil lies within the eye of the Arid Dust Devil. Often some say this is just a naturally strong wind. Others say a more powerful intelligence lies within.

Stoneback Beetles roam the rocky outcrops. These giant boulder sized insects are just as strong as the rocks they resemble. A fight against a Stoneback is said to be like fighting a boulder too, only one that can crush you at will!

These undead soldiers were cursed aeon's ago by a powerful mage. The curse lingers to this day, forcing those affected Primal Guard from the grave to become undead creatures tasked with the guardianship of the ruined temple. Some of the guard are more ruthless than others and brandish bone weapons that they use as clubs to crack the skulls of their enemies.

The Scared locals no longer go to the Graveyard, especially at night when the screams of the undead can be heard echoing through the night. The Screaming Skeletons are thought to have been resurrected by necromancy but who or what has risen these restless dead remains unknown.

The Garagor City Guard are a highly trained group of soldiers that are paid directly by their King. They are equipped with the finest weapons and armor that they can buy with their healthy wages. The richest and most skilled members are the Captains of the Guard, who give out the orders and keep discipline.

Even the cows are not immune to this plague of undeath! The Tendaran Zombie Dairy Cow is roaming the pastures, grazing on any living creatures they can catch. They also make do with the corpses of creatures that have died a true death. They are creating a nasty, poisonous smelling fluid in their udders now, which the Milkmaids are gathering.

These Dungeons has been abandoned for many a year, with both staff and prisoners alike fleeing the screaming horrors that moved into the Dungeon. These spirits were named the Banshees of Misery by those who encounter them as their howl is painful to the ear. The most powerful of these spirits are said to have such a loud wail that they can cause eyes and ears to bleed...

The Sand Djinn are magical creatures of animated sand. They have magic power over sand and can morph it into weapons to kill. Sand Djinn are often blamed by local people for creating droughts and bad sand storms.

The caves here once were home to the now extinct Wyza. These Giant Cobra-like serpents were hunted into oblivion by the Slyvin as sacrifices to their great god Zaq. Now only the angry spirits of the Wyza exist. These Spirits are as much a threat to the Slyvin as they are to anyone else.

Dark Horsemen are a dreaded foe that ride upon their dreaded armored Nightmares. In ancient texts it is told that the Dark Horsemen were in life the 1st Lancers, an ancient and honoured cavalry regiment. The Champions of the Dark Horsemen are the most fearsome of fighters. Upon their armored Nightmares they cut down their foes with enchanted fire blades.

Mangarian Soldiers are backbone of the Mangarian army. These creatures are well skilled with their weapons and tunnel fighting tactics but are said to fair badly when fighting in the open or on the surface. The best fighters of the Mangarian Soldier units are their Champions. They are born to be leaders and are marked with red heads and longer antenna so they can be spotted easily by the rest of the unit.

Mangaria is home to tribes of reptilian Dinosauroids. They are much more intelligent than your average giant reptile that is normally encountered in the area but still have the predatory instincts needed to be efficient predators.

Murk Trolls live in the dirtiest areas of Mangarian and those who know this stay as far away from such places as possible. The Murk Troll is a well muscled greenskin, but thankfully has little intelligence in its ugly head other than the need to hit things and tear them apart with its bare hands and devouring what remains of its victim.

Haloroth Fairies are generally mischievous but they do have a darker side as many of the Fay do. Their are many tales of the Haloroth Fairies using magical glamour to confuse travellers and send them in the wrong direction. The Fairies that have the most potent magic often take charge of the others, creating their fiendish plans and tricks to play on the unsuspecting.

Bugbears are large brutish Greenskins that are covered in greasy hair. These barbaric beasts have recently entered the forest wreaking havoc and breaking everything they come across. It is thought they have been drawn here after overhearing tales of wealth and abundant travellers to feed on.

Dark Radande are magical beings bound to the tree they were born to for the rest of the trees life. The Dark Radande are bound to trees corrupted by dark magics and other evil forces in the forests and have become evil beings capable of great harm to others as a result.

Glacial Giants wonder the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest Yeti legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.

Juggernauts are titanic men of great power and have been sent to the valleys from the coast to police the area and destroy any intruders. The most powerful have been given magic amulets of enchanted ice by their patron. These enhance their power further and melt away if the Juggernaut is ever defeated.

The taming and training a Dragon for use as a mount is very time consuming and dangerous. Therefore only the very rich can afford it. The Fanaraloth Kings of old have taken to having dragon Lords as Guards to their Palace Ward as both a status symbol and a statement of power and strength. Only the most talented and loyal fighters of the Elven Guards are chosen for the honour of wielding the Dragon Blade and riding so feared a beast.

Pirates and Corsairs are not the only sea going enemies on the coast. Skeletal Mariners from the infamous Skelepup ship raid the coast too, but unlike the other scum of the sea the Skeletal Mariners are only interested in looting the souls of those they kill for their captains own evil purposes no doubt...

Sales were falling and the advertising parchments failed. Something radical was required to rekindle the fortunes of the Leisurely Libations group. A travelling Sorcerer offered his aid, naming no price. Suspicious but desperate, the group agreed. The next batch of their carbonated drink sold out with all following batches doing the same! Greatly pleased, the group thought nothing of it until, at a promotional faire the sorcerer appeared, chanting. Those who'd tried the new Libation twisted and transformed into rampaging beasts, skin the color of LLs product! Now these poor unfortunates must be put down!

Designed by : Uncola
Giant Fiddler crabs swarm the Beaches in these parts. Although the smaller type are normally scavengers, these bigger, meaner variations are very aggressive and will tear potential prey apart!

The reef supports a huge amount of sea life that live deep in caves within the coral. The Ridged Gymnothorax is one of the most dangerous of these animals and has a venomous bite. These Giant Eels often hunt close to the surface looking for prey. Thankfully these poisonous terrors are quite rare.

Hellador Orc Warriors assemble within the muddy courtyard of their stinking hold Hellagin. The Warriors of the Ogzog tribe are well armed with the finest of the looted and stolen wargear that can be taken. The leaders of the tribe Orcs go to war with them as their champions and to insure that the battle plan is followed and they don't go wandering away or attack the wrong the targets.

The Bonegwar are fur covered bestial giants that live in the Fridagor plains. Smashers come from the low plains with other Bonegwar where they use their big clubs to break down the homes and defences of villages so they can get at their favourite food more easily.

Tundra Lurchers are tall malnourished creatures that are cursed to be forever hungry. These relatively dumb beings roam Fridagor in their permanent search for food, often devouring each other as they starve. Some Lurchers are gifted with larger claws and more brains that others, giving them an edge over others of their kind when it comes to getting food.

Of all the trees in the swamp, none are as foul and evil as the Wailing Tupelo. These trees are hard to tell apart form normal trees in the swampy forests except for the evil faces wrought into the bark of the tree. The older Wailing Tupelo emits such powerful screams from its faces when someone in near,it can cause the explosion of its victim, leaving little more than a bloody stain in the swamp.

These heartless thieves will take everything you own no matter how much you plead. If someone refuses they simply cut out their heart. They score red notches into their black dagger blades for every kill they make.

The Ornatag Deathspinner is the most deadly species of Giant Spider that live around the ruins. These giant Arachnids are covered in iron hard chitin and their poisonous fangs drip with a venom that is so powerful it is said to instantly liquidise the preys insides, making it easier for the Deathspinner to eat later.

Snorg Fiends are the most cruel members of the Snorgherd. These cruel Beastmen are rounding up Kenathogs citizens for use as slaves or worse. The most cruel and evil of the Fiend find much delight in using wicked looking cat-o-ninetail whips. They are well known for their overuse of these whips on prisoners.

Raptors are dangerous creatures from ancient times. Raptors have thrived extinction by remaining hidden deep in the Boolagor Woods. Few ever survive an attack by a pack of Raptors, for together they form a well coordinated stealthy killing machine. The pack Matriarch will direct the pack to greater killing efficiency, though they are as brutal to their pack as their prey.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. Pine Hypeezles live high up in the trees where they wait for prey to wander below them. When such a target comes by, they jump from the tree and with precision they land upon what will quickly become their next meal before retiring to the trees again.

The Yalamor Juggernaut are savage warriors from the cold lands of Scree. Many of the clan hire themselves out as mercenaries and have found a willing employer in the area. The Clans Juggernauts are titanic men of great power and the most powerful have been given magic amulets of enchanted ice by their employer. These enhance their power further and melt away if the Juggernaut is ever defeated.

This breed of Incendia Treeman is native to the Ithanor Woods and they will fight to protect their home. The Incendia Treemen take after the trees of the forest and have the same forever red foliage, helping them blend in to forest with ease.
Greater Black Jaguar is a powerful but thankfully rare relation to the Greater Jaguar. It is considered a delicacy to the local goblin tribes due to its rich tasting meat.

The Winged Arachnid is a creature created by twisted magics, creating what is basically a giant flying spider. These creatures are only capable of short periods of flight and are not able to create a web like average spiders and so rely on surprise aerial assaults on their prey which they then devour as they catch them. Some Winged Arachnids have large pincers that inject venom into their prey, causing the victim to begin to decompose instantly. A gruesome death indeed.

Stoneback Beetles roam the rocky outcrops. These giant boulder sized insects are just as strong as the rocks they resemble. A fight against a Stoneback is said to be like fighting a boulder too, only one that can crush you at will!

Skorpinok Brutes are the strongest of their kind, these giants patrol the mines keeping everything in check and squashing any who get out of line with their huge stone clubs. Some of the Brutes are covered in stronger exoskeletons than others making them more resilient in a fight.

Dusk Goblin Riders ride huge Cave lizards that have naturally sharp claws which grip the rock floor of the underground Passages. The lizards have a poisonous saliva that paralyses it's victims, leaving the Dusk Goblin Rider with an easy prey.

The recently revealed Gintaraian Ratmen are all quite stupid. They are possessed of a crude animal cunning but they have been taught to use weapons. Individually, they are not too strong but in hordes, they are a fearsome foe! Ratman Vanguard Leaders are in command of the Ratman Vanguard. They seem brighter that most Ratmen!

The hungry dead roam the ravaged this devastated section of Zylath. Some enterprising adventurers have sought to take from the riches of Zylath. Most never leave and they now forever protect the area they once tried to loot.
These Miners have been hardened by toil and pain so that their skin is almost as tough at the rock they carve.
This talented Warsmith has etched advanced armour and defensive runes into their battle staff. One should expect a long fight with this tough opponent!

The Hoaragog Dol Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Pass of the Fallen long before the bastion was built. The most powerful of the Wights are the Hoaragog Dol Ice Wights, beings that are said to be able to freeze a man's blood with but a single look from their evil cold eyes, before cutting him dawn with their icy blades.
The savage Caprabeast defends the Crevasse with total vigilance. All who enter must face these violent and evil beasts.

The Clan Manthalion are savage warriors. Many of the clan hire themselves out as mercenaries and have found a willing employer in the area. The Clans Juggernauts are titanic men of great power and the most powerful have been given magic amulets of enchanted ice by their employer. These enhance their power further and melt away if the Juggernaut is ever defeated.

The Hand Maidens serve their Warmaster in every way. Whether it is bringing him food or killing those who displease him in court. Fast, nimble and very, very deadly, these are hand maidens you do not want to cross!

The Kananash Termite Kings are even larger and are far more voracious than their lesser brethren. Their wicked mandibles have the power to slice through the largest of trees (and doughiest of Warriors) in a single bite.

The Spearmen of the Kananash tribe are numerous and well trained for Orcs. In times of war great units of of these disciplined warriors march over the battlefield destroying all in their path led by their unit champions who keep order by bellowing commands and issuing the odd punch to their Spearmen if they fall out of line.

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the Savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their enemies. The largest of the Honbucks normally lead the herd and are more likely to confront a foe.

The Chameletor is an ultimate ambush predator. This huge reptilian creature buries itself in sand, concealing itself perfectly into its desert surroundings ready to launch itself upon its victim with mind blowing speed and deadly jaws. Chameletors can live for hundreds of years and the oldest of their kind are huge scarred monsters, only getting bigger and more aggressive with age.

Pirates and Corsairs are not the only sea going enemies on the Dead coast. Skeletal Mariners from the infamous Skeledog ship raid the coast too, but unlike the other scum of the sea the Skeletal Mariners are only interested in looting the souls of those they kill. The raiding groups are normally commanded by the strongest of their number, normally the one who has captured the most souls out of them all.

Many of the Zinsaur Hatchlings grow into these Reptilian warriors. Armed with a spear and wooden shield, the Zinsaur Warrior roams the Inthar coast, protecting hatchlings from harm and stopping danger from reaching them from further up the coast. The Zinsaur Warrior is a skilled fighter but is also capable of attacking using its deadly claws and teeth when needed.
Giant Fiddler crabs swarm the Reefs in these parts. Although the smaller type are normally scavengers, these bigger, meaner variations are very aggressive and will tear potential prey apart!

The Deep Coelacanth is close relative to the Giant Coelacanth. It is a horrific giant fish from the deepest area of the sea however like its cousin it can survive some time on land. The Deep Coelacanth can use its fins like legs to push its scaly body over the ice to catch slow moving prey before returning back to the darkness to digest its meal.
The caves here once were home to the now extinct Yanrish. Now only the angry spirits of the Yanrish exist. These Spirits are a threat everyone.

Mamont Warriors were the most powerful warrior the Closine Clans had These skilled warriors rode to war atop huge bull Mamonts crushing and killing any in their paths. The Most powerful warriors of their clans were also the clan leaders, men of great skill and strength. Although now undead they still lead their people to war.

Skorpinok Brutes are the strongest of their kind, these giants patrol the mines keeping everything in check and squashing any who get out of line with their huge stone clubs. Some of the Brutes are covered in stronger exoskeletons than others making them more resilient in a fight.
The Hell Spider Brood Queens are the primogenitors of the swarms of demonic arachnids that haunt this level of the caverns. They dwarf their offspring in every way!

The Cold Rusalki are malicious beings linked magically to the frozen ice that makes up their glacier homes. The Cold Rusalki despise anyone who would dare enter their domain uninvited and delight in freezing their enemies with icy blasts or impaling them upon icicles that erupt from their domains. Some Cold Rusalki are said to be powerful they can freeze the air around them or even their foes blood.

The Sherpan are buried in the icy glaciers natural tunnels by the tribe, seen as mystical pathways for the chosen of the mountain god. These bodies normally freeze solid and become one with the glacier, but there are some cases of the corpses returning from the dead to haunt the tunnels. The most powerful of these corpses have a frozen aura around them that can freeze their victims solid.

The Yelarat Mages are naturally gifted magic users. Using their powers to control the seasons they can insure the conditions here will always be favourable for the Ice Elf way of life. They can also when needed conger up great icy elemental powers to smite the foes of the Yelarat.

The Fiender is a demonic beast that has only recently been spotted in the forest. The Fienders are creatures of filth and poison and they gnaw the trees causing them to wilt and die. These Demons are said to have been sent by and evil force to cause destruction although who or what sent them remains a mystery even to the inhabitants of the forest.

This breed of Incendia Treeman is native to the Helanian Woods and they will fight to protect their home. The Incendia Treemen take after the trees of the forest and have the same forever red foliage, helping them blend in to forest with ease.

Bugbears are large brutish Greenskins that are covered in greasy hair. These barbaric beasts have recently entered the forest wreaking havoc and breaking everything they come across. It is thought they have been drawn here after overhearing tales of wealth and abundant travellers to feed on.
Greater Black Jaguar is a powerful but thankfully rare relation to the Greater Jaguar. It is considered a delicacy to the local goblin tribes due to its rich tasting meat.

These undead soldiers were cursed aeon's ago by a powerful mage. The curse lingers to this day, forcing those affected Primal Guard from the grave to become undead creatures tasked with the guardianship of the ruined temple of Tor-Nok from invasion by the local Orc tribes. Some of the guard are more ruthless than others and brandish bone weapons that they use as clubs to crack the skulls of their enemies.

These heartless thieves will take everything you own no matter how much you plead. If someone refuses they simply cut out their heart. They score red notches into their black dagger blades for every kill they make.

These massive brutes are native to the Onaroc forests. The Onaroc Ogres are a savage lot, wearing furs and trinkets taken from their defeated enemies. The champions of these Ogres proudly display the skulls of it's slain victims in a necklace around their giant necks.

The Bentaroth Deinotherium is a huge Elephant like beast that roam these lands. Few would dare confront such a powerful and dangerous beast though packs of Bentaroth Bastet Lions often try to make a Deinotherium lunch, many being crushed to death by the beasts raw power as they try.

The Oldest and most evil Sibisu are known as the Aged. These beings appear to be made from cracked and burnt sand. Tales tell of how these beings are indestructible for once destroyed and their sandy bodies are scattered to the winds they will slowly reform again in another location.
The Pirate Queen rules over the Coast and commands the a great pirate fleet that has been the scourge of the surrounding seas.

The reef supports a huge amount of sea life that live deep in caves within the coral. The Ridged Gymnothorax is one of the most dangerous of these animals and has a venomous bite. These Giant Eels often hunt close to the surface looking for prey. Thankfully these poisonous terrors are quite rare.

The vicious Ice Lizard Alpha is seen as the leader of the Ice Lizards primitive tribe structure but mostly he is leader because he is the most hungry member of the species, obsessed with eating meat. They will stop at nothing to get what he craves.

The Clan Yilnaroth are savage warriors from the cold lands of Scree. Many of the clan hire themselves out as mercenaries and have found a willing employer in the area. The Clans Juggernauts are titanic men of great power and the most powerful have been given magic amulets of enchanted ice by their employer. These enhance their power further and melt away if the Juggernaut is ever defeated.

Deep in these dark forests live Black Deer, not unlike the Deer of other lands except their hide is as black as pitch. The Kingstags rule over the herds of Black Deer in the forest and viciously protect them. These huge Deer are larger and more deadly than any of their kin and a charge from their antlers is bound to prove fatal.

Hypeezles are large weasel type creatures that live deep in the forest. Hypeezles are noted for their insane savagery in a fight and refusal to back down from even the most suicidal conflict. Pine Hypeezles live high up in the trees where they wait for prey to wander below them. When such a target comes by, they jump from the tree and with precision they land upon what will quickly become their next meal before retiring to the trees again.

The Sloclorin are an ancient race of treemen that live in harmony with the forest around them. The Ancient Sloclorin are the leaders of their people and are as old as the forest is, indeed many remember when their was not much forest here at all. These slow beings rarely move unless they have to, preferring to ponder the meaning of trees and give wise council to their people.

The Fiender is a demonic beast that has only recently been spotted in the forest. The Fienders are creatures of filth and poison and they gnaw the trees causing them to wilt and die. These Demons are said to have been sent by and evil force to cause destruction although who or what sent them remains a mystery even to the inhabitants of the forest.
This dark spirit moves with an almost hypnotic serpentine grace. This is the only attractive aspect of the malevolent demon, as seeks only to bring pain and misery to the living for it's master.

The Elves of Venarian are proud and strong. The City has never fallen to an aggressor because the Elves test themselves constantly in the Forest around them. The savage wilds keep them from sleepy apathy.

Due to their lust for blood and death, the Deathsabre has been honoured by the Dreadlord with enchanted armour that uses these destructive emotions to fuel the fires of their blades to burn the flesh of the living as well as cut.

The Honga are ghost like earth spirits. Peaceful creatures generally, the only thing the Honga hate is those who despoil the earth and steal its minerals and dig it away. This wrecks the Hongas perfect view of the ground they drift through like a sea. Any Man, Elf or especially Dwarfs that mine the ground is an enemy, and don't get them started on armor and weapons made from ore...

The Knocker Warriors guard Gantharoth with brute strength and their enchanted blades. The Warriors of Knocker society are even more malevolent that others of their kind and it is said that they are rewarded by the king of Gantharoth for their evil deeds. The most mean of the Warriors will take charge over the others and are often armed with extra equipment or covered in gems given as rewards by the king.

The Spearmen of the Farellian tribe are numerous and well trained for Orcs. In times of war great units of of these disciplined warriors march over the battlefield destroying all in their path led by their unit champions who keep order by bellowing commands and issuing the odd punch to their Spearmen if they fall out of line.

These massive brutes are native to the Jagarat Plains. The Jagarat Ogres are a savage lot, wearing furs and trinkets taken from their defeated enemies. The champions of these ogres proudly display the skulls of it's slain victims in a necklace around their thick necks.

The Yethmore Deinotherium is a huge elephant like beast that roam these lands. Few would dare confront such a powerful and dangerous beast though packs of Yethmore Bastet Lions often try to make a Deinotherium lunch, many being crushed to death by the beasts raw power as they try.

Rock Golems are beings made from the hardest of stone and rock, bound together by powerful natural magic. Their massive forms are all but impervious to damage and are capable of crushing any man or beast that dares threaten them. The Oldest and most grumpy of their kind get so angry they go molten with rage. The added fiery heat from these giant beings makes them even more dangerous!
In contrast to their golden cousins, these Satyr have learned to tolerate other species within its habitat. However, these Satyr will protect their territory should they feel threatened in any way.

Gray Hag Queens are powerful witches that are in charge of The Gray Hags sisterhood. The Queens form a council that controls the actions of the sisterhood and its targets. The Queens are ancient crumbling beings that have lived for centuries in the ruins thanks to their strong magical powers, and may have even been responsible for this civilisations destruction in the first place though none can know for sure.

Dusk Goblin Riders ride huge Cave lizards that have naturally sharp claws which grip the rock floor of the underground Passages. The lizards have a poisonous saliva that paralyses it's victims, leaving the Dusk Goblin Rider with an easy prey.

Spitting Lizards dwell in the sand dunes. These reptiles are quite weak and find it hard bringing down prey in the vast open areas of the desert so they have evolved the ability to spit out jets of venom at their prey that burns and weakens the victim, making them easy prey. Even if they did not make the kill the largest spitting lizards always get to eat first by bullying others.

The Death Abnegated were prisoners here when the dungeon still functioned. They died in alone in their cells but part of them refused to cross over to the other side, still hopeful of rescue, release or revenge. Some of these ghostly spirits have less of a grasp on reality than others and have been known to murder and hunt down any who enter the dungeon in mad rampages.

With a bit of practice the lyrics to the Tome's mantras begin to trip of the tongue and even pictures can manifest of a strange world filled with otherworldly creatures. No one quite knows where the Tomes come from, but that all part of the thrilling mystery of it.

Even the cows are not immune to this plague of undeath! The Garanok Zombie Dairy Cow is roaming the pastures, grazing on any living creatures they can catch. They also make do with the corpses of creatures that have died a true death. They are creating a nasty, poisonous smelling fluid in their udders now, which the Milkmaids are gathering.

The Malogre are a race of turtle like beings that lived the slow life upon the marsh. Then plague came and turned the marsh poisonous and deadly. The Malogre who lived here succumbed to it, turning into the undead. The Shroud Wreathed Malogre has had his soul burned out by the baleful energies of the Shroud.

The Palanak Forest Polarweres are native to this cold land. They are foul tempered beasts that are part man but their reason and mind have been consumed by the spirit of the polar bear. The Polarwere Alphas are even more fearsome than their lesser kin, easily outfighting thee local Trolls and making a messy meal of them.

The Einherjar are warriors who's skills in combat far outstretch those of mere mortals.  These lone warriors are said to have transcended death and been brought back from the afterlife so they may once again fight and hone their skills. None will ever know the truth however for the Einherjar are mute and always kill any who come close.

Deep in these dark forests live Black Deer, not unlike the Deer of other lands except their hide is as black as pitch. The Kingstag's rule over the herds of Black Deer in the forest and viciously protect them. These huge Deer are larger and more deadly than any of their kin and a charge from their antlers is bound to prove fatal.

The Fiender is a demonic beast that has only recently been spotted in the forest. They are creatures of filth and poison and they gnaw the trees causing them to wilt and die. Who or what sent them remains a mystery to the inhabitants of the forest.

The demand for Yeti pelts and meat can make a high price in many of the far flung ports and cities of the world. The best Yeti Hunters often wear Yeti pelts to better hide them in the snow so they can sneak up on their prey.

The Erlatay are beings from the ancient world long trapped in the ice of the Glacier. These beings have somehow lived through the millennia and some still carry dreaded and ancient diseases on them, diseases that should have died with these ancient beings but still crawl upon their ravaged flesh. Getting to close to these Erlatay is to invite a painful death through infection .
Carpabeasts are savage killers that are generally servants of the Shadow Lord whom they worship as a god. The greatest of their number have a majestic crown of horns.
This Demon delights in snuffing the life light from anyone it finds. There are tales of the Gas Demons drinking the souls of their victims.

These beasts were imported from a distant unknown tropical land by shadowy traders. The creatures have come to be known as Hell Rippers for they have nasty demeanour's and the magical fires burning from their mains. The rare Blue flamed Hell Rippers are more powerful and have since become the kings most favorite exotic pets.

Gray Hag Queens are powerful witches that are in charge of The Gray Hags sisterhood. The Queens form a council that controls the actions of the sisterhood and its targets. The Queens are ancient crumbling beings that have lived for centuries in the ruins thanks to their strong magical powers, and may have even been responsible for this civilisations destruction in the first place though none can know for sure.
The Fandorn Smiths are constantly at work making arms for the warriors. The oldest Smiths often have rune etched tools making them better at forging weapons and also cracking skulls.

The Einherjar are warriors whos skills in combat far outstretch those of mere mortals. These lone warriors are said to have transcended death and been brought back from the afterlife so they may once again fight and hone their skills. Some Einherjar are said to have left the path of becoming better warriors and have become debased, seeking new ways to torturer and maim their victims rather than outright kill them in combat.

These undead soldiers were cursed aeon's ago by a powerful mage. The curse lingers to this day, forcing those affected Primal Guard from the grave to become undead creatures tasked with the guardianship of the ruined temple of Tor-Nok from invasion by the local Orc tribes. Some of the guard are more ruthless than others and brandish bone weapons that they use as clubs to crack the skulls of their enemies.

Weeping Swampman are almost humanoid beings that shamble through the swamp. They resemble nothing much more than a large mass of rotting swamp plants, roots and mud. These Swampmen make crying noises and their eyes glow with an unearthly light. Local legends say these beings are fuelled by the souls of those who die lost in the fens and as a result have magical powers that can slow its prey from escaping its deadly grasp.

Few have survived encounters with the near mythical Fire Golems. Legends state that the black steel cage like effigies that contain the roaring fire of the Golem within were created by Mages deep under a fiery mountain and thus it is they whom these beings will serve until they are extinguished.

The lands of Hanarakk are plagued by the creatures known as Lava Raptors. The Lava Raptors seem quite at home in the sweltering heat and use the heat to their advantage when hunting prey by waiting on the prey to tire in the heat before moving in for the kill.
Judging from the fine armour and sword this undead was probably a elite swordsman in life. But whatever he was in the past, he now eternally drags his greatsword mindlessly through the Zornoth trees.

These formless vampires appear as only a blur in a roughly human shape. The only features that can be picked out are their blood red eyes and a fanged mouth. These ghostly creatures prey upon the living. The more they feed the more corporal their form becomes, growing bones and organs and eventually skin and transforming into an even more powerful creature once fully flesh.

The Karlilion Deathspinner is the most deadly species of Giant Spider that live around the ruins. These giant Arachnids are covered in iron hard chitin and their poisonous fangs drip with a venom that is so powerful it is said to instantly liquidise the preys insides, making it easier for the Deathspinner to eat later.

The ancient Stormcall Dracs believe it is their divine right to strengthen the portal in Karlilion Castle with their sorcerous powers. This portal is believed to be the source of the storm itself although none, not even the Dracs, know for certain. Rumor has it something calls to the Drac as a race, a primeval voice that is compelling them to empower the portal.

Raptors are dangerous creatures from ancient times. Raptors have thrived extinction by remaining hidden deep in the Tarillian Forest. Few ever survive an attack by a pack of Raptors, for together they form a well coordinated stealthy killing machine.

The Tarillian Doomsaur are the undead remains of the predators that once lived in Tarillian. The Doomsaurs still crave for the flesh of the living although they may never be able to taste it ever again.

The Giant Sea Snake does not live exclusively in the sea, but is most at home there hunting large fish, dolphins and other large monsters of the deep. When not at sea they live in coral caves along the coasts side. The venom of these serpents is not that powerful but when you're as large as a Giant Sea Snake it doesn't have to be.

The Elephus Bahamut is a giant species of man-eating fish that has a long trunk atop its fanged mouth. These strange-looking creatures are covered in horny scales that are stronger than steel and are said to make fine armor for those who can get them. They use their trunk to grasp prey from the shore or boats and once caught in their grasp there is no chance of escape.

The Ithnar had many legends about undead creatures and the supernatural with the Soul Keepers featuring in many such legends. These beings of undeath were said to be the spirits of evil sorcerers that refused to truly die when their time amongst the living was over. The Soul Keepers got their name from their ability to steal the living essence from a person, thus denying the person an afterlife of their own.

Sewer Crawlers are sewer-dwelling arachnids that can grow to large sizes by feeding on waste that is found in abundance in the sewers, and are capable of surviving in this harsh environment thanks to its surprisingly high resilience to disease. Some Sewer Crawlers begin to grow spikes upon their carapace, these Crawlers are generally seen as being more vicious than usual.

Raptors are dangerous creatures from ancient times. Raptors have thrived extinction by remaining hidden deep in the Karatani Woods. Few ever survive an attack by a pack of Raptors, for together they form a well coordinated stealthy killing machine. The pack Matriarch will direct the pack to greater killing efficiency, though they are as brutal to their pack as their prey.

Bugbears are large brutish Greenskins that are covered in greasy hair. These barbaric beasts have recently entered the forest wreaking havoc and breaking everything they come across. It is thought they have been drawn here after overhearing tales of wealth and abundant travellers to feed on.

This breed of Incendia Treeman is native to the Coraniath Forest and they will fight to protect their home. The Incendia Treemen take after the trees of the forest and have the same forever red foliage, helping them blend in to forest with ease.

The Bindaran Forest Polarweres are native to this cold land. They are foul tempered beasts that are part man but their reason and mind have been consumed by the spirit of the polar bear. The Polarwere Alphas are even more fearsome than their lesser kin, easily outfighting thee local Trolls and making a messy meal of them.

The Ronthan Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Ronthan Pass long before the bastion was built. some legends speak that these vile creatures used their dark magic to enslave the men at Ronthan to their will.

Due to their lust for blood and death, the Deathsabre has been honoured by the Dreadlord with enchanted armour that uses these destructive emotions to fuel the fires of their blades to burn the flesh of the living as well as cut.

The Katalopian Royal Guard protect the queen and they will gladly die doing so. These warriors are powerful and armed with deadly spears and covered in and exoskeleton stronger than any knights plate armor. The Champions of the Guard are the only ones with direct contact with the queen and are often seen as being the personal bodyguards to the queen.

The Garagoth Termite Kings are even larger and are far more voracious than their lesser brethren. Their wicked mandibles have the power to slice through the largest of trees (and doughiest of Warriors) in a single bite.

The Chameletor is an ultimate ambush predator. This huge reptilian creature buries itself in sand, concealing itself perfectly into its desert surroundings ready to launch itself upon its victim with mind blowing speed and deadly jaws. Chameletors can live for hundreds of years and the oldest of their kind are huge scarred monsters, only getting bigger and more aggressive with age.

The Winged Arachnid is a creature created by twisted magics, creating what is basically a giant flying spider. These creatures are only capable of short periods of flight and are not able to create a web like average spiders and so rely on surprise aerial assaults on their prey which they then devour as they catch them. Some Winged Arachnids have large pincers that inject venom into their prey, causing the victim to begin to decompose instantly. A gruesome death indeed.

Vurnak Orcs form the fighting core of the local tribe. Large, powerfully built warriors, these mostrous warriors surge forward, bellowing their war cries and following their champions into the thickest fighting! These grizzled veterans know how to get into the best fights as well as pinpointing the weaknesses that lead to the best loot and slaves!

The Kurak Senators are out in force. However, they, like many of their ilk are getting in the way, shouting to be heard and bellowing over each other. If the city defences have a weak spot, this is it. The Senate Leaders are even better at bellowing orders no one is listening too. They have a modicum of skill with a blade, having had access to the finest tutors.

The Pigool is a special species of Halfling bred pig. Humans also farm these animals and make good money selling on the meat to travellers as the pork of the Pigool is said to be some of the best in the world. The Pigool Boars are protective of their own and with their sharp tusks will defend other Pigool fearlessly.

The Haaneth City Guard are a highly trained group of soldiers that are paid directly by King Iiroe. They are equipped with the finest weapons and armor that they can buy with their healthy wages. The richest and most skilled members are the Captains of the Guard, who give out the orders and keep discipline.

This breed of Incendia Treeman is native to the Gilderan Woods and they will fight to protect their home. The Incendia Treemen take after the trees of the forest and have the same forever red foliage, helping them blend into the forest with ease.
The Doomsaur are the undead remains of the predators that once lived in Aquia. The Doomsaurs still crave for the flesh of the living although they may never be able to taste it ever again.
Greater Black Jaguar is a powerful but thankfully rare relation to the Greater Jaguar. It is considered a delicacy to the local orc tribes due to its rich-tasting meat.

Kotorath  Fairies are generally mischievous but they do have a darker side as many of the Fay do. There are many tales of the Kotorath Fairies using magical glamour to confuse travellers and send them in the wrong direction. The Fairies that have the most potent magic often take charge of the others, creating their fiendish plans and tricks to play on the unsuspecting.
Giant Fiddler crabs swarm the Beaches in these parts. Although the smaller type is normally scavengers, these bigger, meaner variations are very aggressive and will tear potential prey apart!

Pirates and Corsairs are not the only sea-going enemies on the coast. Skeletal Mariners from the infamous Skeledog ship raid the coast too, but unlike the other scum of the sea, the Skeletal Mariners are only interested in looting the souls of those they kill for their captains own evil purposes no doubt...

The Barotic Deathspinner is the most deadly species of Giant Spider that live around the ruins. These giant Arachnids are covered in iron-hard chitin and their poisonous fangs drip with a venom that is so powerful it is said to instantly liquidise the prey's insides, making it easier for the Deathspinner to eat later.
It is unclear if this is one spirit or many. But what is obvious is that the Bone Hail sweeps through the Elya Fortress venting its murderous anger on anything it finds.

These spirits were named the Banshees of Misery by the towns folk as their howl is painful to the ear. The most powerful of these spirits are said to have such a loud wail that they can cause eyes and ears to bleed...

The Ratmen Slicers are known for keeping pet rats, that they gorge on the flesh of their enemies. Some of the Slicers are also breeders of a type of huge rat known as the Gigantic Rat. These rats can grow up to the size of a bull and are very dangerous creatures. The Slicers take great pride in breeding strange deformities in their rats, especially ones that make them more dangerous to the enemy such as spikes or long claws.

With a bit of practice the lyrics to the Tome's mantras begin to trip of the tongue and even pictures can manifest of a strange world filled with otherworldly creatures. No one quite knows where the Tomes come from, but that all part of the thrilling mystery of it.

The Kantorite Bandits are the worst of scum to be found in the forest. Most are criminals and murderers that have escaped the law. The most dangerous of these Bandits gather around them the like-minded and organize raids on those travelling through the forest.

These Orcs built several small villages in this area. The Olcrani Savages use poison from local plants to coat their weapons and bodies when they go into battle as it makes them more dangerous. The Orcs love the danger of these forests but when there is a lack of dangerous beasts around to fight they often go and wage war against a neighbouring clan's village for fun.

The Vipesh Shamen are ancient creatures who live away from Vipesh society and even their own people do not seek them out unless the need is dire. Here in the silence of the marshes they contact their evil god Voresshh and devise foul spells. Some Shamen are closer to the other side than others, drawing powers directly from dangerous realms. These Shamen burn with demonic power.

The Boroka are terrors of the sky, more fearsome than the storm itself. These unnatural creatures resemble black-winged horses but with the face of a screaming fanged woman. They hunt for those trapped on the islands to feed upon. The strongest of these terrors also have the longest manes. These winged beasts lead herds of Boroka when hunting.

The reef supports a huge amount of sea life that live deep in caves within the coral. The Ridged Gymnothorax is one of the most dangerous of these animals and has a venomous bite. These Giant Eels often hunt close to the surface looking for prey. Thankfully these poisonous terrors are quite rare.

The Ice Lizards are a reptilian race of vicious cold-blooded killers who will attack anything and anyone just for the taste of warm flesh. The Ice Lizards dwell in the frozen waters waiting for warm-blooded prey to come along before striking, clawing and biting at their prey before dragging them into the sea to be eaten.

Glacial Giants wander the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest Yeti legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.

This breed of Incendia Treeman is native to the Quindaneth Woods and they will fight to protect their home. The Incendia Treemen take after the trees of the forest and have the same forever red foliage, helping them blend into the forest with ease.

The Sloclorin are an ancient race of treemen that live in harmony with the forest around them. The Ancient Sloclorin are the leaders of their people and are as old as the forest is, indeed many remember when there was not much forest here at all. These slow beings rarely move unless they have to, preferring to ponder the meaning of trees and give wise counsel to their people.

The Necral were an ancient tribe that lived in the mountains, dabbling in dark magic and worshipped evil gods but have since died out. Often in the caves, the Necrals greatest warriors known as the Haunters will rise as a result of their dark magic rituals. These warriors were buried in the finest of bronze armour and  with the best of weapons and are a dangerous foe to behold.

Hot volcanic ash storms often sweep the plains. It is from within these storms that the feared Mares of Doom charge. These horse-like creatures, made from the very ash of the storm, trample and burn those unlucky enough not to have taken shelter from the storm. The strongest of these storms are said to be able to cook a man alive in his armor or seer his flesh from his very bones!
The Ifrit Djinn are magic winged creatures of fire that hold the power to burn all in their path and the most powerful of their kind are said to be able to immolate the very air around them.

Recently Dwarfs had been seen in the Ketoric mountains. Sometime later the mountains exploded with lava and created what is known now as the Ketoric flow, endangering the city. Some think the Dwarfs are behind the flow but none know for sure. Ketoric Dwarf Chargers are the foot soldiers of the Riangi Dwarves. These Dwarves are armed with huge reinforced shields that they use to bash into their enemies with bone cracking force, and that's even before they attack with their battle axes.

The Spearmen of the Skar tribe are numerous and well trained for Orcs. In times of war great units of of these disciplined warriors march over the battlefield destroying all in their path led by their unit champions who keep order by bellowing commands and issuing the odd punch to their Spearmen if they fall out of line.

Thornvine Dryad Warwitch is a much more powerful type of Thornvine Dryad. Unlike their sisters, they are rarer though they make up for this with a staggering grasp of natural woodland magic and an incandescent rage which dwarfs even their sister's anger over the damage done to the local woods.

Tundra Lurchers are tall malnourished creatures that are cursed to be forever hungry. These relatively dumb beings roam Arkl in their permanent search for food, often devouring each other as they starve. Some Lurchers are gifted with larger claws and more brains than others, giving them an edge over others of their kind when it comes to getting food.

The scared locals no longer go to the Tiranok Graveyard, especially at night when the screams of the undead can be heard echoing through the night. The Screaming Skeletons are thought to have been resurrected by necromancy and the strongest of their number are the former champions of Tiranok.

The Tiranok City Guard are a highly trained group of soldiers that are paid directly by the Kingdom. They are equipped with the finest weapons and armor that they can buy with their healthy wages. The richest and most skilled members are the Captains of the Guard, who give out orders and keep discipline.

These beasts were imported from a distant unknown tropical land by shadowy traders. The creatures have come to be known as Hell Rippers for they have nasty demeanours and magical fires burning from their manes. The rare Blue flamed Hell Rippers are more powerful and have since become the king's most favorite exotic pets.
These Satyr have learned to tolerate other species within its habitat. However, these Satyr will protect their territory should they feel threatened in any way.

Rock Golems are beings made from the hardest of stone and rock, bound together by powerful natural magic. Their massive forms are all but impervious to damage and are capable of crushing any man or beast that dares threaten them. The Oldest and most grumpy of their kind get so angry they go molten with rage. The added fiery heat from these giant beings makes them even more dangerous!

Herds of Razox roam the tundra of the Ungla Mountains. Razox Bulls are huge creatures and are very protective of the herd. A charge from a Razox Bull is generally fatal as they crush their enemies with pure strength or cut them to shreds on their razor sharp horns.

The Honga are ghost like earth spirits. Peaceful creatures generally, the only thing the Honga hate is those who despoil the earth and steal its minerals and dig it away. This wrecks the Hongas perfect view of the ground they drift through like a sea. Any Man, Elf or especially Dwarfs that mine the ground is an enemy, and don't get them started on armor and weapons made from ore...

Yannick Dungeon has been abandoned for many a year, with both staff and prisoners alike fleeing the screaming horrors that moved into the Dungeon. These spirits were named the Banshees of Misery by the townspeople as their howl is painful to the ear. The most powerful of these spirits are said to have such a loud wail that they can cause eyes and ears to bleed...

Politark is home to tribes of reptilian Dinosauroids. They are much more intelligent than your average giant reptile that is normally encountered in the area but still have the predatory instincts needed to be efficient predators.

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their enemies. The largest of the Honbucks normally lead the herd and are more likely to confront a foe.

This deadly species of plants is capable of growing at an incredible rate, carpeting areas of the swamp. Their most dangerous feature is the ability to "spit" a venomous liquid from its flower at entities nearby it considers a threat.

The vicious Ice Lizard Alpha is seen as the leader of the Ice Lizards primitive tribe structure but mostly he is leader because he is the most hungry member of the species, obsessed with eating meat. They will stop at nothing to get what he craves.

The Kendarar Dol Wights are ancient undead warriors that were said to haunt the Pass of the Fallen long before the bastion was built. The most powerful of the Wights are the Chara Dol Ice Wights, beings that are said to be able to freeze a man's blood with but a single look from their evil cold eyes, before cutting him dawn with their icy blades.

The Lackter Mages are naturally gifted magic users. Using their powers to control the seasons they can ensure the conditions here will always be favourable for the Ice Elf way of life. The Greatest of these Mages is employed to enchant demons.

The Erlatay are beings from the ancient world long trapped in the ice of the Glacier. These beings have somehow lived through the millennia and some still carry dreaded and ancient diseases on them, diseases that should have died with these ancient beings but still crawl upon their ravaged flesh. Getting too close to these Erlatay is to invite a painful death through infection.
This Demon delights in snuffing the life light from anyone it finds. The Dwarves have tales of the Gas Demons drinking the souls of their victims.

Capcauns are huge brutish creatures that dwell in caves in the area. The Capucun are ogre sized beings with snarling dog like faces that carry clubs which they squash their prey with. The Capucaun are addicted to eating humans and if the scent of man is in the air they will travel long distances to find and devour the unfortunate person. The most savage of the Capucaun are so addicted they go as far as attacking their own kind in a frenzy in order to get at human flesh. As such they are shunned by their own brethren.

The Chameletor is an ultimate ambush predator. This huge reptilian creature buries itself in sand, concealing itself perfectly into its desert surroundings ready to launch itself upon its victim with mind blowing speed and deadly jaws. Chameletors can live for hundreds of years and the oldest of their kind are huge scarred monsters, only getting bigger and more aggressive with age.

The Sand Djinn are magical creatures of animated sand. They have magic power over sand and can morph it into weapons to kill. Sand Djinn are often blamed by local people for creating droughts and bad sand storms.

The Ifrit Djinn are magic winged creatures of fire that hold the power to burn all in their path and the most powerful of their kind are said to be able to immolate the very air around them. The Ifrit Djinn are under the control of the evil sorcerer Koura and have been sent to destroy those he has foreseen in his Seeing Stone have come to attack him and stop his evil plans.

Magma Centaurs are bestial creatures with the upper torso of a man and the head and body of a Magma Lion. These are not noble creatures, more content with stalking prey in the plains and brawling with others of their kind. Magma Centaurs are led by the strongest of their kind, the ones who win all the brawls and bring the biggest kills back home with them.

The Einherjar are warriors whos skills in combat far outstretch those of mere mortals. These lone warriors are said to have transcended death and been brought back from the afterlife so they may once again fight and hone their skills. Some Einherjar are said to have left the path of becoming better warriors and have become debased, seeking new ways to torturer and maim their victims rather than outright kill them in combat.
The Harrathor Doomsaur are the undead remains of the predators that once lived in Harrathor. The Doomsaurs still crave the flesh of the living although they may never be able to taste it ever again.
Greater Black Jaguar is a powerful but thankfully rare relation to the Greater Jaguar. It is considered a delicacy to the local goblin tribes due to its rich tasting meat.

The Vomit Crab has evolved to live in the wettest areas of the jungle. The crab ensnares its victims by vomiting a crippling venom on its prey. Its armored carapace is capable of shrugging off most attacks from the few predators it has. The Larger Vomit Crabs have large fiddler-like claws that they use to defend their own kind from harm.

This deadly species of plants is capable of growing at an incredible rate, carpeting areas of the swamp. Their most dangerous feature is the ability to "spit" a venomous liquid from its flower at entities nearby it considers a threat.

These mischievous creatures are under the influence of Heitwar. They constantly harass Eltwier defenders from high above, hurling large rocks at the defenders below. It is often the largest of these creatures that are seen leading Winged Hellion flocks, it is thought that these larger Hellions are under the direct control of the lord of the castle.

Bugbears are large brutish Greenskins that are covered in greasy hair. These barbaric beasts have recently entered the forest wreaking havoc and breaking everything they come across. It is thought they have been drawn here after overhearing tales of wealth and abundant travellers to feed on.

Kandara Fairies are generally mischievous but they do have a darker side as many of the Fay do. There are many tales of the Kandara Fairies using magical glamour to confuse travellers and send them in the wrong direction. The Fairies that have the most potent magic often take charge of the others, creating their fiendish plans and tricks to play on the unsuspecting.

With a bit of practice, the lyrics to the Tome's mantras begin to trip off the tongue and even pictures can manifest of a strange world filled with otherworldly creatures. No one quite knows where the Tomes come from, but that is all part of the thrilling mystery of it.
These devastated ruins are slowly crumbling into dust and rubble. Only the undead now lurch through the shadowy alleys and streets of the once vibrant quarter.

The Chodrmen are a race of Shark people that live deep under the sea, often coming to the islands to hunt or battle with Corallians. The Saw Chodrman are among the strongest and most deadly of their kind. Naturally armed with a huge saw-like nose, they can wield it with terrifying skill in battle slashing at foes within reach. Any not caught by the ripping teeth of the saw will be attacked by the twin tooth blades the Chodrman also carries.

The reef supports a huge amount of sea life that lives deep in caves within the coral. The Ridged Gymnothorax is one of the most dangerous of these animals and has a venomous bite. These Giant Eels often hunt close to the surface looking for prey. Thankfully these poisonous terrors are quite rare.

Pirates and Corsairs are not the only sea going enemies on the Dead coast. Skeletal Mariners from the infamous Skeledog ship raid the coast too, but unlike the other scum of the sea the Skeletal Mariners are only interested in looting the souls of those they kill. The raiding groups are normally commanded by the strongest of their number, normally the one who has captured the most souls out of them all.

The Creeping Hanbi are thin dark-skinned creatures that have fanged skulls for faces. These beings gather in the darkness in large groups waiting for prey and learning the deadly 1000 curses of Akkazariorn Rah in the hopes of one day rising to become one of the Shadow Hanbi.

Few have survived encounters with the near mythical Fire Golems. Legends state that the black steel cage like effigies that contain the roaring fire of the Golem within were created by Mages deep under a fiery mountain and thus it is they whom these beings will serve until they are extinguished.

These lands are plagued by the creatures known as Lava Raptors. The Lava Raptors seem quite at home in the sweltering heat and use the heat to their advantage when hunting prey by waiting on the prey to tire in the heat before moving in for the kill.

Hornbucks are fast antelopes that live on the savannah. They are normally passive creatures but when spooked they will charge with their giant, out of proportion horns rather than run away as they know they have a good chance of goring their foe.

Of all the trees in the swamp, none are as foul and evil as the Wailing Tupelo. These trees are hard to tell apart form normal trees in the swampy forests except for the evil faces wrought into the bark of the tree. The older Wailing Tupelo emits such powerful screams from its faces when someone in near,it can cause the explosion of its victim, leaving little more than a bloody stain in the swamp.

The Gentathor Dol Wights are ancient undead warriors said to haunt the Pass long before the bastion was built. Some legends speak of these vile creatures using their dark magic to enslave the men at Gentathor Dol to their will. The most powerful of the Wights are the Gentathor Dol Ice Wights, beings that are said to be able to freeze a man's blood with but a single look from their evil cold eyes, before cutting him dawn with their icy blades.

Glacial Giants wonder the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest Yeti legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.

Deep in these dark forests live Black Deer, not unlike the Deer of other lands except their hide is as black as pitch. The Kingstag's rule over the herds of Black Deer in the forest and viciously protect them. These huge Deer are larger and more deadly than any of their kin and a charge from their antlers is bound to prove fatal.

The Sloclorin are an ancient race of treemen that live in harmony with the forest around them. The Ancient Sloclorin are the leaders of their people and are as old as the forest is, indeed, many remember when there was not much forest here at all. These slow beings rarely move unless they have to, preferring to ponder the meaning of trees and give wise counsel to their people.

The Champions of the Dark Horsemen are the most fearsome of fighters. Upon their armored Nightmares they cut down their foes with enchanted fire blades, gifted to the greatest of the regiment's warriors.

The plains are often swept with hot volcanic ash storms. It is within these storms that the feared Mares of Doom charge from. These horse-like creatures are made from the very ash of the storm, and the stronger the storm, the more powerful the Doom Mare within it. The strongest of these storms is said to be able to cook a man alive in his armor or seer his flesh from his very bones!

Spitting Deathworms live just below the ground, waiting for prey to come past their burrow. Once prey has been detected they rise up from the burrow and spit a jet of highly dangerous venom at the target. This venom blinds and burns the victim, making it an easy kill for the Spitting Deathworm.

The Deadaxe Orc tribe are a mercenary that is now under the pay of Motoroth. Few men would ever have dealings with such dangerous greenskins but Motoroth knows the value of such troops and uses them as the spearhead of his army.

The strongest of the Orcs are the leaders of these greedy, evil mercenaries and get the highest pay and best loot from battles.

Sand Goblin Chiefs are the leaders of the Sand Goblin clans that swarm the dunes. These leaders are little better than others of their clan and have gained their position of power through treachery and bribes. These self important characters full of themselves and dress accordingly but also have access to the clans best war gear and poison it with desert spider venom accordingly.

The Sand Djinn are magical creatures of animated sand. They have magic power over sand and can morph it into weapons to kill. Sand Djinn are often blamed by local people for creating droughts and bad sand storms.
The caves were once home to the now extinct Wyza. These giant cobra-like serpents were hunted into oblivion. Now only the angry spirits of the Wyza exist.

The Cold Rusalki are malicious beings magically linked to the ice that comprises their glacier homes. The Cold Rusalki despise anyone who dares enter their domain uninvited and delight in freezing their enemies with icy blasts or impaling them on icicles that erupt from their domain. Some Cold Rusalki are said to be powerful; they can freeze the air around them or even their foes' blood.

Polarweres are native to this cold land, foul-tempered beasts that are as much man as they are ice bear. The Polarwere can easily tear a man limb from limb and are feared even by the greenskins in the area.

Glacial Giants wonder the snow drifts looking for fights and things to eat and the most brutal of their kind often carry clubs made from trees to bash their foes with. The Giants are quite dumb and are at home in the cold weather. Some of the oldest Yeti legends claim the Giants were created by their Ice God Faryl to protect the lands from invasion.
